title: FAMILY use
review: The whole family uses this app. Meditation, sleep stories to help time the Meditations or to set an intention for a Meditation this is a great app to keep a daily, inspired practice. My daughters will drift off to the sleep stories when having trouble going to settled after an active day.

title: Fabulous!
review: This is the first sleep app I‚Äôve ever loved so much I‚Äôve paid for it! I love that I have so many options to help me sleep! And I love the sleep stories for kids. title: Great for kids
review: This app paid for itself in the sleep stories that help calm my kids before bed. We also read to the kids but to help them sleep they have loved the sleep stories. When someone is upset before bed this is our go to!!!!!

title: DAY 2!!!!
review: Really helps guys. I thought I was going to have to go to the doctor. My first day started on Sunday and I was the most productive I ever was at work today. I‚Äôm from the Houston Tx area. I promise it‚Äôs worth the meditations. Do your mood check ins and compare!! I will be using as often as possible.

title: Not Worth the Exorbitant Cost
review:
The voices/narrators used are not soothing at all. That was a surprise given the seemingly high production quality. It does not feel chill, for lack of a better term; rather, it feels like you're in a university lecture. Not good. 

Additionally, I simply don't find the content helpful. There are free resources that helped me better. 

I'm a healthcare worker who downloaded this to help w acute stress. I can't recommend this at all to anyone going through any kind of real stress. It's just weak tea that doesn't even sound good.

title: The best!!
review: The app has helped not only my but my kids during this difficult times. When we all went on quarantine the anxiety level was through the roof in my house. And between the meditations, story night and evening wine downs, we learn to calm ourselves down

title: Not worth the cost
review: I was pretty disappointed by the limited somatic practices and rather narrow and repetitive daily prompts. I feel like this app tries to provide too many services and stretches itself thin, which compromises the quality that can be achieved. There are some really nice functions in this, but overall I feel I only am interested in 30% of what the app offers and the quality of that 30% isn‚Äôt worth the cost

title: Transforms
review:
The Calm App has transformed myself and my world. The wide array of mediations and sound scapes allows me to stick with doing the mediation and being able to truly relax and feel
grounded. I can say now after a year plus of being on the Calm App, I have more peace and harmony than ever.

title: Great app!
review: The sleep stories are great. One minute I can‚Äôt sleep, the next minute I‚Äôm awake the next morning, well rested. I think the key is that you fall asleep while listening to the story. That‚Äôs what‚Äôs on your mind, not problems or schedules or to-do lists or stress. Try it, well worth the $$$$!

title: A lot to offer
review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for a year now. It has helped me cope with so much. I like how it has meditation but also music and inspirational talks. I became a lifetime subscriber just recently. Highly recommend. We all need calm in this very tumultuous world we‚Äôre living in right now.

title: The BEST app made.
review: I have stressful days and typically cannot sleep. The sleep stories are like a magic pill. I can‚Äôt end a story and then when I start where I left off the next night, I still can‚Äôt finish! And the music is great for walks. I will be using this app a lot more.

title: Best think to happen since I got married and had kids
review:
I have always been a busy person. Distractions come in waves and used to be overwhelming. The daily 10 minute session has become my baseline status every morning. What a wonderful feeling...

<3
2020
<3

title: Changed my outlook
review:
I suffered with intense depression and low self-worth. I have been practicing Calm for three years and counting. 
Tamara‚Äôs view on being kind to yourself, steering away from negativity has brought me into a place of contentment, joy, and hope.
I could go on and on. Calm is transformative.

title: Money (sigh)
review:
Dear Calm,
Now I know that you have to make money some how and don‚Äôt get me wrong I love the app but, I think it‚Äôs expensive. I‚Äôd probably be a lot more happy with this if you didn‚Äôt have to pay all at once. I think that the people who probably need thing app most aren‚Äôt all the ones willing to pay for it.
Sincerely A Costumer

title: It‚Äôs ok but way to expensive
review: I have a lot of things. 1. This app is so stressful. I try to look for nice sounds to fall asleep to and to listen to. But most of the sounds are locked and cost money! 2. title: Love Calm
review: I love this app! There are so many options for exploring mindfulness and the sleep stories. It has been nice that the mood check in is an added feature and that it will send me a daily meditation reminder. This app has helped my family and we love it!

userName: Harry potter is my life lol
title: It‚Äôs good but..
review: I really really think this app is amazing for everyone, especially as a midday teenager suffering from anxiety and sadness this is good for me but as a teen I don‚Äôt have a ton of money, and the stuff I use money for is other important things I just wish the app had more options to listen to, like more calm audio books or meditation things to listen to instead if just like 3

title: Settle anxiety with the Calm app
review: This app has so many useful tools for someone who is struggling to navigate through life. It also helps calm active minds, even during the ‚Äúgood times.‚Äù Inspirational quotes, sleep stories & much more. There are a wide variety of authors & story tellers to chose from. Give it a try.

title: Calm review
review: I  love and feel that the story‚Äôs and 7days of calm helps me a lot but I have only tried some of them because  I think that the calm premium is very expensive and also olmost every thing is for calm premium only so I think that if there were more things free and/or premium was less expensive I‚Äôd give it a 5 star app.

title: Meditation changed my life

title: Calm review
review: This is the best app out here to help anyone sleep for example on school nights I can‚Äôt seem to sleep and once I get on the app let it sit on my pillow and listen to the rain I fall asleep so calmly and quick and I wake up so peaceful and like nothing happened I make no sense but this is the best app

title: You need this in your life.
review: After reading what you guys are doing for athletes like Naomi Osaka, I re-downloaded your app and gave it a real shot. I was down and not having a good start to my day and remembered this app. It changed my entire day...and I have become a Calm believer! Peace of Mind, in an app!

title: Wonderful app but cost to much for an app when there are so many others that are free
review: Thankful for our God who has guided me through 64 years on the beautiful ever changing and exciting world that he made for his children to enjoy til his son returns to take us home to be with him

title: More narration variety needed.
review: I love this app but do not find Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice to be calming at all. I feel like her narrating voice is forced and even has a tone reminiscent of being condescending. Don‚Äôt get me started on the vocal fry. Since most meditations are narrated by her, especially the daily calms, this makes a lot of content that irritates more than relaxes me. There needs to be more variety in the meditation narration.

title: highly recommend!
review:
this app has helped me fall asleep every night for the last year! it has been very helpful, but i would like to point out that there is not a way to make a playlist/line up of sleep stories, and i have to go back through the process of waking up/falling back asleep after putting on a new story.

otherwise, there are a huge number of sleep stories, and the readers are very diverse. the price seems very expensive, but i have definitely used it to it‚Äôs fullest potential, and it‚Äôs worth the cost.

title: Enjoying Calm
review: I downloaded Calm to start the new year, and am enjoying the Daily Calm, Masterclasses, and music features of the app. Thanks to Jeff and Tamara for their 10 minute guided meditations every day, your effort and insights are appreciated. Overall, the app is easy to use and a nice resource to practice mindfulness.

title: Locked
review: Hello, I don‚Äôt believe mental health should have to cost money to get. I want to calm down about money, not spend money doing so. I hope this helps you change your app a bit Calm! I gave it four stars because I like the Feeling part and I don‚Äôt want to be mean.

title: Working on me
review: I love the tools available in this app to help me work on me and deal with my feelings/emotions/anxiety. This is not only a form of self help but self care as well. Really enjoying this app and I just started a week ago. I can‚Äôt wait to see what a year out looks like!

title: Calm
review: Being new to the Calm experience, three days in, it is far smore than advertised. My experience has only started  and already I sense  a freeing of the soul, enhanced slumber and sense of creative wonder. My world, that was gradually narrowing, just opened to a universe of unending possibilities and creative delight. Thank you.

title: Really does help
review: We‚Äôve listened to The Office every night for years, as we go to sleep. This has been as good, if not better. Certain sleep stories just aren‚Äôt for us. I‚Äôm curious as to how they choose the readers, because some just don‚Äôt make sense. But everybody has their preference. Either way it has been enjoyable.

title: For the ads alone
review: Thanks, Calm. You are great and your TV commercials are great; never thought I'd say that. In a century that promises to be a consumerist hellscape of advertising driven surveillance capitalism, here's a product that doesn't maim, torture, or subjugate anyone. If you turn out to be spies on my data, I will kill us both.

title: So relaxing

title: Four and a half

title: One of the best meditation apps available
review:
I‚Äôve been using the premium Calm for about 3 years, and if you compare what you got back then and what you‚Äôre getting right now is amazing.  

There are a lot of resources for you to enjoy, Daily Calm (my favorite), meditation classes, music, Sleep stories, and so on.

The only thing for me that is missing; is the Alexa integration.

While there are other meditation apps with their respective skill on the Alexa ecosystem Calm is not.

I just hope you guys could sort the thing keeping you to get the Alexa skill out.

Keep up the good work!

title: Calm - Amazing
review: Calm makes me so relaxed all the time. When ever I am down or something is wrong I can always occupy myself or make myself feel better using calm. Also, sometimes when I am just bored calm is a good way to meditate, relax, or even try to sleep. It is awesome!

review:
Like I said in the title ‚¨ÜÔ∏è

title: A no for me

title: Narrator/voice options needed

It would be nice to have diversity in the vocal narration of the meditations that could be more soothing to people.

title: This app was fine until Lebron showed up
review: Sorry, I can‚Äôt have any part of that race-baiting , riot-enticing lebron. Saw that commercial and instantly got rid of this app‚Ä¶ too bad. title: Just what I needed
review: Like many as we slowly progress through this pandemic my anxieties were compounding daily. Calm has helped turn my phone into less of a messenger of bad news and more a place where I can relax. Delete social media and download calm.

title: Amazing

title: Calm helps me center myself
review: Calm is the tool I chose to center myself for each day. After only 3 days of participating, I believe that I have made the correct choice and I will continue with that plan. It is an easy yet effective program to assist with mood and feelings.

review: So today I just got the app and I don‚Äôt have enough money to do the premium and there are only like a couple things you can do without the premium and I did one today and tomorrow i was going to do the next one and it is locked so I wish this app had more options to do without premium I might have to find a different meditating app

title: Helping Me
review: Only three days into using this Calm app and I am very pleased with it. I suffer from insomnia and tinnitus. The tools on here for relief are abundant.  I especially like all the various options. And there is lots of positivity type messages and stories. Thank you for creating this app.

review: It has been a nourishing time since I downloaded Calm. I am 6 months into my practice and every time, I feel like I am doing something good for myself. Treating ourselves better should be just as important as treating those around us well.

review: I wanted to test the app, but once downloaded, there‚Äôs really nothing free to try. The app forces you to pay for the yearly membership after the 7 day trial. What happens if folks don‚Äôt want to commit to an annual subscription? This practice is just plain greedy IMO.

title: Love the app hate some of the voices

title: Great App But......

Also, there are times it won‚Äôt even work so you have to delete and unsubscribe the app then reload the app again. The makers need to fix this issue!

title: Help doesn‚Äôt work

When you try to enter your help request in the app, it shows only a few letters of a large awkward internal keyboard that is impossible to use or even resize, rendering typing anything impossible unless it consists entirely of q, a, z, w, s, or x. I cannot rate this highly when essential features don‚Äôt work and there is no way for me as a paying user to contact the company to report this.

title: A genuine life-changer!

title: Stop with the Celebrities
review: I loved this app until they started featuring celebrities on their content. Calm was an app I used to get away from media and now every time I open it, there‚Äôs a new famous face building their personal brand. I thought Calm was about mindfulness, not ego. If Harry Styles wants to read a bedtime story, fine. But does the former boy band member need his face to sell it? Does it have to be creepily romanticized as ‚Äúdream with me‚Äù? Now it‚Äôs Lebron James, Ellie Goulding, Kelly Rowland, Matthew Mcconaughey. I feel like Calm sold out. Can‚Äôt wait for Kim K‚Äôs guided breath work.

title: WTH.......

title: You have to pay

title: Sleeping so well

title: Calm is super!

title: Anxiety Is My Demon

title: Life changing!
review:
I sometimes fall asleep on the couch while watching TV and then struggle when I move to bed.  I would then wake up an hour after falling asleep, get up and eat and toss and turn all night.

With Calm I listen to a story and try to stay awake until the end but I fall asleep around ten minutes into the story. I stay asleep all night and for the past 7 days I am feeling outstanding! I have lost weight and enjoy my job. 

I have been wanting to get to bed around 9:30 and waking up before the alarm at 6:00am. 

Great job!

title: inappropriate politics

title: CALM
review: CALM is calming. I love this app! It guides you into a state of mindfulness in an unobtrusive way. title: Diversify
review:
I enjoy the app overall. But why pay for a yearly subscription when most of the guided meditations are led by one race? People who meditate are diverse so the variety of guides should be as well.

According to an article in the times:

Some archaeologists date meditation back to as early as 5,000 BCE, according to Psychology Today, and the practice itself has religious ties in ancient Egypt and China, as well as Judaism, Hinduism, Jainism, Sikhism and, of course, Buddhism. Meditation‚Äôs global spread began along the Silk Road around about five or six centuries BCE, as the practice moved throughout Asia. 

Given that, couldn‚Äôt there be more People of Color leading the mediations? Or at the very least as others have mentioned, maybe have alternative voices for various topics and sessions?

title: Promotion
review: I entered through the american express promotion going premium and cannot open meditations that have a lock on the top. It keeps asking if I want a 7 day trial. How may I open them without going on the trial but with the premium one year promotion?

title: Nice but...
review: Good meditations but once I‚Äôve finished a series and unlocked each part, there should be a continuous play option. It‚Äôs silly to have to come out of a meditative state to tap on the next meditation within one series. It needs to have the option of continuous play.

-Lots of non-meditation ‚Äúperks‚Äù (Soundscapes, stories, etc)
-Generous free trial
-Easy cancellation

Cons:
-Slim to no non-guided meditations
-Guided meditations are heavily wordy‚Äîcompared to other apps like headspace

This app is better for people who need life coaches rather than someone who wants traditional meditation.

title: Best New Habit for 2019 & 2020

I suggested this to many friends and convinced at least 25 friends to use it daily with me. I love when I see them share the daily thought with me, knowing they forgot I got them started. 

Love the night stories to help me fall asleep, love the various challenges to focus on different needs. 

I recommend everyone get this app. Not surprised to see it‚Äôs in first place in health & fitness.

As a heart patient, calming meditation is not only pleasant but healing mentally, physically and spiritually.  Its about survival.  It‚Äôs about about love, letting go and being in the moment.  

I have been using Calm for over a year now and I still use it, at least once , each and every day.

Live and let live, love, breathe, listen to some Moody Blues and be Calm.

title: I‚Äôm upset.

I just wish this was free and accessible to people with paying because it seems like an amazing app. It would be great if you could possibly do something about that thanks and sorry.

title: Love it!!!

title: Offer a monthly subscription
review: Hi there. It is very frustrating when you are trying to use an app to reduce anxiety and stress, but yet one of the best apps to help with that is $70. Not everyone can afford that much at one time. You should allow consumers to purchase monthly subscriptions. I would be happy to pay $7 per month for this, which is roughly $14 more per year than what you‚Äôre getting now.

title: Maybe helpful for young people
review:
The first meditation I tried here mentioned Stephen Covey. If you don't know who that is this app could be right for you. 

But for those with with any experience in or knowledge of what was once called self-help or even had a rudimentary introduction to boilerplate corporate motivational materials hoisted onto employees in the eighties and nineties, you might be left wanting more. 

I was suspicious of the big name celeb guests, like Matthew McConaughey but decided to try it. 

We are all trying to figure out life and depending on where you are on that journey, this might be your ticket. I really mean that. But for me, I find the approach from an app like Headspace to be more straightforward and genuine. 

I wish you well.

title: Sleep stories

I would also like to cue up stories.  Please remove Mathew McConneghy from the first line of every option. It is offensive.

title: Love but would love some more
review: I do love the Calm app. It helps relax my brain and the non-fiction stories are the best for fading off to sleep. I would love some more male readers. Those are the most relaxing voices. A little tired of Alan. Loved Matthew and LeVar, and Jerome especially. My favorite is Dr Osman though with his sleep suggestions. Definitely need more male readers.

title: It a ‚Äúgive me 69$ each year to have everything‚Äù
review: I opened the app, signed up, and the next thing is 69$ for premium. You may ask, ‚Äú how else would they make money?‚Äù Oh I don‚Äôt know, maybe HAVE A DONATION BUTTON! Anyway I went to the sleep section and I‚Äôve only seen 2 free recordings. I would by this app that have to spend money each year.

title: Best calming app ever !
review: This app has so many features, and so calming. I had it for more than a year now, and till this day I still use it. I love the soundscapes, my favorite as it helps my environment to be peaceful. I really recommend to anyone !

title: A calm life.
review: It is so important with  my life full of joy,  and full of difficulty  that I take the time for a little calm. I love this app there is something fun for everyone. Thank you everyone who gives to us through the app. Martine

title: The best app ive ever had
review: I was convinced I‚Äôd only do the 7 day free trial but this app is incredible, and I‚Äôll be purchasing the full year. It helps me drift to sleep more easily and has a ton of great features like mindfulness and music. Highly recommend.

title: Something for everyone
review: I have always enjoyed meditation and Calm provides great opportunities to expand my practice. Now Jeff Warren is a part of Calm and I couldn‚Äôt be happier!  He is by far my favorite teacher.  Looking forward to more meditations with him.

title: Peace at last
review: I use this app almost every night helps me sleep so much better I can‚Äôt thank you enough Keith urban for your contribution to the site everyone should try listening to this

title: It‚Äôs ok
review: It‚Äôs not the best because you need a subscription to listen to sleep story‚Äôs and other things it‚Äôs really hard for me to find a story that I don‚Äôt need a subscription for so if there were more story‚Äôs that don‚Äôt require a subscription then the app would be a lot better but I see lots of potential for this app

title: Well worth it
review: I had been debating for over a year whether to try this app or not. I decided to go for it. Oh have a high stress job and this app has been a wonderful experience to let go of a lot of that stress.

title: Read the privacy policy. Creepy!
review:
O stars

I heard about this app on a morning news program, read the great reviews so I downloaded it. Then I read the privacy policy and said no thanks.
In order to use all the features of this app you have have to agree to allow cookies not only from the app developer but from third parties too. I don‚Äôt allow cookies. Your information is shared with 3rd parties you know nothing about!  If you are giving them personal information - especially medical info it is not private. 

With the recent problems multiple websites have had with people‚Äôs personal info being collected by 3rd parties I no longer trust anyone to keep my data safe so this app is deleted from my phone.

title: Complete transformation
review: I have no idea where to begin but I completely love this app. It is a must have and I know you will not regret this choice. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

title: Charges after canceling
review: I‚Äôve been fraudulently charged two years now for this app after I canceled it. I confirmed with Apple I haven‚Äôt used it since 2018, and the calm website and their customer service confirmed I don‚Äôt have a subscription. I‚Äôm still trying to get my money back. It is definitely not worth $60 a year which is why I didn‚Äôt want it. Everything it offers you can get for free from podcasts.

title: Life changing app.
review: Seriously, if you haven‚Äôt downloaded this app...stop thinking about it and just DO IT! Even at the free level, the features are better than anything else out there.

title: Cluttered, annoying new design
review: I‚Äôve been a paid subscriber for two years and use this daily. But the recent redesign it harder to find what I want; it‚Äôs cluttered with too many categories (‚Äúmental fitness‚Äù). The app is too pushy about promoting categories I don‚Äôt use/don‚Äôt care for. Allow users to design their own menu.

title: The Price is Stressful
review: It‚Äôs a shame that during these stressful times when people are loosing love ones, jobs and businesses during a pandemic that this app is charging so much. I was very excited to use this app however I was quickly disappointed with the price to unlock items. The price of this app is stressful. iTunes‚Äô editors really needs to reevaluate their list of recommendations. There are other  apps that can do the same job for free.

title: Insomniac
review: I can‚Äôt believe that after so many sleepless nights just one night of Calm and have to say I never slept so long and peaceful in my adult life.  I opened my eyes 12 hours after I closed them   Thank you for helping me‚ùóÔ∏è

title: Truly the best app on your phone.
review: Mindfulness and spirituality is way more important than you would think. Meditation grants you the key to unlocking the work bench of your brain. This app just facilitates a smooth and easy success.

title: Really helpful
review: I was really depressed and lost after a break up. Calm helped me a lot to focus on the things that matter and helped me care about myself more. Also helps me go to sleep and relax when I‚Äôm feeling anxious.  Thanks !

title: Calm
review: Right as I tapped on the first video the person‚Äôs voice came and I knew it was gonna be good. I am kind of depressed a lot, and this app, even though I‚Äôve just started using it is really helping me start to be happier.

title: Way too expensive
review: I love this app but I wish that the subscription wasn't so expensive or there were more free things to do on there. Like open your eyes guys, some people aren‚Äôt made of money! Heck some people don‚Äôt even have money and may be desperate for this app and have little to nothing to use on the app. So stupid.

title: Frustrated because I can‚Äôt find a way to give in-app feedback
review: I love this app but I‚Äôm frustrated because I can‚Äôt find a way to give in-app feedback. There should be a ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù tab or something similar if you have problems or suggestions!

title: Sleep and peace
review: I have enjoyed much better sleep using this app.   The content of the sleep stories is so interesting. I especially love the trains and Scotland settings. Most of the time I am asleep before they even get started.

title: Waste of time
review: Used the app once before it crashed every time I opened it.  tried deleting the app, resetting my phone, and nothing will make it work

title: It‚Äôs all good but
review: I love this app it helps with stress and many other things but there isn‚Äôt a lot of free things on here it makes me sad that I‚Äôm not able to do more of the sessions on here. I would have to repeat some of the same stuff. Please please please let there be more free sessions on here

title: So far soooo goood
review: I just started using Calm for a 10-minute meditation to begin my days. It‚Äôs work to stay focused but I feel great support from Tamaron Levitt and her voice is very calming. I hope to be using Calm‚Äôs support for the foreseeable future. Thank you Calm.

title: Can‚Äôt stand this app
review: The voice of Tamara, who is in every meditation, is annoying at best. People seek meditation when they are stressed. Her voice is too happy, and not relaxing- almost making me feel guilty that I can‚Äôt relax.  And there is not a variety in voices. I also thought there would be more kid content, but there are only 1-2 sleep stories for kids. I have tried deleting this app, but I still get reminders. I wish I never subscribed.

title: Great app
review: This is absolutely great app it has great music and meditation exercises but I have one very small complaint that will not be even noticeable to anyone and that is the breathe noise when I am on the breathing exercise with the purplish color. Over all Amazing app

title: Locked Stories
review: The reason I gave it 3 stars is because mostly all of them are locked and the voice on the kid stories are really creepy, But it did help me fall asleep. I would recommend this app if you need to fall asleep faster. But most of the stories/ meditation stuff is locked. I would only lock the 5 star stories.

title: Helpful
review: I struggle with anxiety anyway, and with a pandemic upon us I‚Äôve enjoyed using calm as a tool.  I‚Äôve used it during the day to deepen my mediation or yoga.  Also used it at bedtime to relax and find deep sleep.  Would definitely recommend it to a friend.

title: Start the day with calm
review: My husband and me start every day with calm....in todays world of daily bombardments of stress causing news in ones immediate world and the outside world ...meditating with calm helps one tap into what is most important...the breath and being consciously in the now

title: Calm at last!
review: Had this app for quite a while, never seemed to ‚Äòhave the time‚Äô to take a break and listenü•¥ until this morning!  Oh Boy, can‚Äôt hardly believe it! I struck gold, daily reminder set, excitedü§óü§ó

title: A necessity
review: Whether taking a 5 minute break to clear my mind or listening to something soft to help me sleep, this app does it all. I absolutely love the various options and recommend it to everyone.

title: ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù Review
review: Calm is a great app for everyone I am an eleven year old boy and I have trouble falling asleep this app changed all of that for me and there are stories for all ages not just for small children but even some I could see adults enjoying.

title: New to meditation
review: I‚Äôm new to meditation and it‚Äôs taken me quite a while to do it consistently on a daily basis but this app is wonderful in helping me to establish a practice. This practice is having an immense impact on my life in dealing with all the things that occur throughout a day.

title: Love every thing about it~
review: The title is a little weird I know but hey, it very calming I use it to help me take breaths and have amazing quotes put I don‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs a Inapp  purchase and you HAVE to buy the stories I really hope the creator of the app sees this! P.S. over all BEST APP EVER

title: So many ways to escape!
review: I love this app!  The daily meditations are perfect for an escape at lunch and I fall asleep with the ‚Äúmusic‚Äù (usually rain) on a timer every night.  It‚Äôs worth every penny to have relaxation always at my fingertips.  So glad I found ‚ÄúCalm.‚Äù

title: Worth it!
review: This is worth the investment! Pay now or pay later in medical bills! This is prevention! Rather this is life! JESUS went to a quiet place all the time I wonder what He did durning those times? Probably a bit of what you get here on Calm!

title: Wonder is great!
review: I have used this app for about a week now and the only story I have listened to is Wonder by Matthew McConaughey! I still have haven‚Äôt heard the end of the story because I am asleep before it‚Äôs over! Loving this app so far!

title: App does not open!
review: I have used this app for more than a year to help me fall asleep.  When I tired to use it last night, the blue screen opens telling me to take a deep breath and then closes! I have current IOS and most recent calm update.  Please fix this problem. üòï

title: Life changing
review: Meditation has been life changing for me. It helps me stay in the joy of gratitude more of the time. And Calm is a motivating way to make meditation more of my life. I believe it is helping change the nuero pathways in my brain and I feel more hopeful.

title: Easy and always available!
review: I‚Äôve used calm for quite some time now...I have had a lot of meditation experience and use calm for quick moments throughout my busy day to help remind me to stop and check in. I also enjoy the ambient sounds and music.

title: Calm
review: Every day I try to do the daily calm. Calm makes meditating so much fun with all the different types in the guide and The meditating that comes on every day. I love using Calm and I will use it normally if I‚Äôm being stressed at school. Calm Is always there to help me relax!!!

title: Great app ‚ù§Ô∏è
review: Omg I love this app! It has awesome sleep stories by awesome narrators! Its also is worth the extra money you can put into it. I put the money into it and I always fall right asleep. the breathing exercises are amazing! I hope you install it! Enjoy!

title: Best meditation app
review: I have come to love meditation and calm is the one that has brought this peace into my life by teaching me. I had to start small and now I can meditate up to 30 mins and want more. It helps me with my daily life everyday.

title: So Amazing
review: Calm is one of my favorite apps for myself and my children. There are so many resources to help you relax. My children love the sleep stories. I love everything! Definitely an app that you should get to ease worry, frustration and tension.

title: Calm mind and helps put my child to sleep!
review: This app is the best money I‚Äôve ever spent. In just a couple months of using it I‚Äôve begun a meditation practice, slept better and even helped my sleepless 7 year old get to sleep at a normal hour.

title: Nightly Use!
review: I really enjoy using this app almost on a nightly basis. 1 recommendation in an area to expand is your sleep stories nap selection. I really like this feature as I am woken up rather easily due to how you structure the recordings. It would be nice if you had a larger variety.

title: Awesome but...
review: This is an awesome app that has helped me get to sleep faster than I have been able to in over 5 years. But...I would love to be able to cue up several sleep stories to play back to back, so that I don‚Äôt have to look up a new sleep story.

title: Nothing calming about audio books
review: Complete waste of money. Didn‚Äôt find anything calming about it. Maybe it works for some people but not me. I was expecting more from it but really only found various audio recordings you have to listen to for 30+ mins a day. It doesn‚Äôt help that it auto billed after the trial and I had to pay for a year. Try the free trial but watch out for the re-bill like any other free trial.

title: A Godsend!
review: Especially during this stressful last year, the CALM app has helped us relax and sleep more soundly!  We love Tamara‚Äôs soothing voice and all of the fantastic meditation options. Thank you for creating such an invaluable tool!

title: Mixed
review: I also have another similar sleep story app which allows one to have a ‚Äúplay list‚Äù of stories. Calm has much better stories and meditations but the developers refuse to add the playlist feature. (I have asked) it‚Äôs odd because they have a playlist feature for music. Love the stories but I need a longer series of stories when sleeping so I must rate it down.

title: Its ok.
review: I did the trial and canceled on the last day but was charged a subscription for a year.  This app doesn't help me meditate.  Theres no time setting and most of guided meditation is one lady and her voice doesn‚Äôt resonate with me.  There are other ones but overall its hard to navigate and its best features are nature sounds. I keep trying with this since now I had to pay for it but still end up using another app with timers.

title: App needs work
review:
I love the meditations, but the app needs work. 
First, please give us the ability to airplay from the app.
Second, the new version of the app for iPad stops playing when you shut off the screen. 
Thank you.

title: Mood changing for the better

title: Really!!
review: I thought that once I saw this app had only one thing free to help me meditate my sleep I felt like deleting this app. But that one thing helped me more than I thought! And so I won‚Äôt be deleting this app.

title: Love but....
review:
I love this app for the sleep stories, but I‚Äôd like to be able set up our own playlist or 2 or 3 stories in a row. I usually can‚Äôt fall asleep with just one and it‚Äôs inconvenient to open the app back up on my phone and set up another sleep story when I‚Äôm trying to fall asleep. 

Otherwise, love the content!!

title: Meditation makes a difference
review: I always meant to meditate but did not have the discipline to get started on my own. The calm app is fun & easy and has helped me work meditation into my daily routine.  I‚Äôm more at peace and focused during the day as a result

title: Don‚Äôt trust the free trial
review:
I downloaded this app to help me with my problems from falling asleep, unfortunately it didn‚Äôt help me whatsoever.

I tried to cancel the membership from the first day as stated on the website‚Äôs instructions yet it still charged me, and now I‚Äôm stuck with a 1 year membership which is a waste. The 14 day free trial is a scam. (I didn‚Äôt want a freebie and wanted to pay for 1 month yet they didn‚Äôt give me an option for that either)

title: Premium subscription
review: I think calm is great, I have been using it for a month, there are things to help calm down, and deal with anxiety, but they are locked, unless you pay for it. And I really need to use that, but I can‚Äôt, but other than that, calm is great

title: What I want is a playlist feature.
review: Its middle of the night an the story ends but you are still awake so you have to get up and change the story. I‚Äôve done this a lot and I just need a playlist so I don‚Äôt have to get up and change the story.

title: Amazing app
review: I love this app so much but to get anything they kinda make you buy the premium so I would say if you get this app be aware that there isn‚Äôt many options if you don‚Äôt subscribe to them. Other that‚Äôs that it‚Äôs a great app and I would recommend.

title: Lifeline
review: Been of fan of this app since my freshman year of college, recomendad by a therapist. I‚Äôve left it came back many times, but like I say I always come back. No other app has compared. Calm will always be my life line.

title: Grateful
review: I bought this for myself last February. It was a birthday gift to me. I had no idea how valuable it would or how much I would learn. If you don‚Äôt know where to start go to How To then head to Loving Kindness. Everyday I‚Äôm grateful for this time.

title: Mixed
review: There are some great features, like the master classes. But it‚Äôs more gimmicky than substantive, and it seems like you can‚Äôt search for things like ‚Äúbreathing‚Äù or ‚Äúbody scan.‚Äù (Just found the search feature: why is it buried in a menu?) The style of the main female narrator is too sugary/theatrical for my taste. Would love more Tara Brach! She‚Äôs incredible.

title: Harry styles
review: i used to use this app because i need a noise for when i sleep, and this was very soothing, but then i started listening to podcasts, so i did delete the app. I‚Äôm redownloading it again due to Harry styles, but that‚Äôs okay

title: A great ode to teachers
review: I got my calm membership for a discount as a teacher. I find myself more stressed in the summers than during the school year. Calm has helped me to find structure, peace, and joy in my days and nights during these stressfully unstructured Covid summers. Thanks Calm!

title: Great!
review: Great app! Love to use it to meditate and to do the feeling and gratitude check ins! But... a lot of the things you have to pay for. I personally don‚Äôt pay for it but I can see why people would pay for it. Like I said, a great app for meditating but a lot you have to pay for.

title: Great App but no Google mini cast option
review: Calm is great app with good selection of music and meditation sessions. Took off one star as it does not allow the music to cast on google mini/home speakers. I would be good to have that feature to have the music play in different rooms of the house

title: So helpful!
review: My Kaiser health plan is offering a year‚Äôs membership for free so I signed up. Tons of wonderful tools! This would be helpful at any time, but especially now. I will definitely be continuing once my free year ends. Definitely worth it!

title: Not good App Unless you want to spend $70 a year
review: I was super excited to get this app until I downloaded it and it said if you want all the stuff, like stories and calming methods, you have to pay $70 a year. I chose I didn‚Äôt want to pay that, because I thought it was free and also I just wanted a good calming app. Super disappointed, but if you would want to invest in something like this, great options for calming methods.

title: Great and relaxing, but lots of it costs money
review: This app is a great app, it is very relaxing and helps relieve stress, makes you feel good. however, you can‚Äôt do much with it without paying a subscription, you can only do a few things without it.

title: More free podcast
review: This app is amazing! Although I just want to address that maybe you guys can consider making more free stuff. Not everyone can afford it, and everyone needs a good nights sleep. So if you see this just know this app is AMAZING!! Though I would like if you could make it fair and add more free stuff. Thank you for your time.

title: This was helpful
review: Since I got this app, it‚Äôs helped me to be patient, among other things. I love this app, I just wish there were a few more things that I could do without having to get premium. Thanks!

title: Ambitious but annoying
review:
I tried this app. I found most of the meditations, music, and bedtime stories to be distracting.  I think others may benefit, but to me most of the content was annoying.

You will also be continuously hounded to get the $70 a year subscription as soon as you try the app.  Yes, you get one week free, but cancelling the subscription takes time and effort.  Buyer beware.

title: Very poor interface
review: Ironically, this application is an exercise in frustration. I am trying to link my paid one year subscription to Alexa Echo. After going through all the crap, I am told ‚Äúauthorization required.‚Äù There is no explanation for this, so I am stuck. One would think, given their calming mission, these folks would hire designers who understand user friendliness, instead of user hostility. Fortunately, these people have competition.

title: Mindset guidance
review: CALM is a great tool to have to prepare your mindset before the start of your day or even when winding down to relax . The Meditation section is awesome. Especially during Covid19 Stay at Home is a great App to down load to mentally stabilize your mindset üôåüèº

title: Calm review
review: I purchased the app after seeing ads on Facebook. The ad revealed tunnel/wormhole that you were going through in space. I purchased after seeing ad. after purchasing I found out calm  app doesn‚Äôt have that feature . Basically false advertising. I would also like to see less talking during their scenes and more natural sounds

title: Just a Wander
review: In the past I‚Äôve tried to meditate sometimes successful sometimes not. Just stated using the app and relearning the basics of meditation and hopefully over time become more at peace. Calm overs quite a lot of insights into beginners, and advanced users.

title: More sleep meditation
review: Love the app and am committed for at least a year! I don‚Äôt know where else to leave this feedback but can you please have more sleep meditations? Would like to see that section get as many updates as the sleep stories one!!

title: This app is amazing
review: When I came to this app I became for happy and it helped me sleep.I had a hard time but when this app came out I was so happy it helped me so much!You need to get this app right I couldn‚Äôt do anything without it!

title: Clam is amazing
review: Clam is amazing it gives you stories and meditation and breathing exercises I definitely recommend getting it I totally would rate this a five star because there is nothing wrong with it is amazing i would so get it

title: It requires payment
review: I know I may get hate for this and I love this app... but it requires payment for 90% of the things. I‚Äôm a 14 year old looking for some nice calming things to listen to and this is a great app... but I don‚Äôt have any payment to enjoy the 90% that requires payment for this app.

title: The premium
review: I like calm I love it but before the premium it was the best thing ever I think that you should be able to  pay a low price for a single one or two or three its kinda like cable but that‚Äôs all And if you ever take the hidden lagoon away I‚Äôll quit calm

title: This actually works..
review: I'm not know for sleeping well but with calm I rarely am awake past what must be the first couple pages, I rarely remember anything in the morning and I sleep through the night. I'm actually surprised..

title: Great app but
review: This app is really good I would recommend it, but if you want to use the app more than once you have to pay for it. There is 1 free sleep story, a couple meditation plans are free, but only the fist day. Like I said I would recommend this app but you have to pay.

title: Eh
review: The app seems so useful for meditation and going to sleep but I‚Äôm not even able to use the sleep stories because every single one is locked. It‚Äôd be so much better if it had one free thing in each category like one free song or one free bedtime story because it really not able to experience it to the full extent.

title: PLEASE READ THIS
review: Calm seems like an AMAZING app. But if you‚Äôre looking to not spend any money, this is not for you. There is only around 10 meditations that are free. Everything else costs $40 a year or $15 a month ( when it was on sale). None off the stretches are free, neither are the sleeping meditations. All the free meditations are more off how to meditate. If you‚Äôre looking to invest in a meditation app, then this one is for you.

title: Best mindfulness app
review: I‚Äôve been doing meditation and mindfulness the past 7 years, and this is hands-down the best mindfulness app out there. Cultivate your inner peace, and tranquility by consistently using this app. Love it! This is one of my dream companies to work for someday.

title: Calm in the moment
review: I am learning how to remain in the moment during meditation. I am relaxing and staying focused on my breath. I feel relieved and calm . I am enjoying the time with being with myself. Peace comes over me in the moments of meditation!

title: Mornings
review: Calm is my best friend in the morning.  I typically awake with anxiety. The lessons in this app have been very helpful in allowing me to get my day started on a positive note.   Generally, when the anxiety returns during the day, I can turn to the calm app and relieve it.

title: Favorite library erased
review:
What did you do with my library of saved meditations? The "heart" option was removed from the channel/category area, and now all of my saved content is gone. Is there a fix for this? I have 385 mindful days, bru; please let me keep the meditations that got me there. 
I loved the ux before this update, and can‚Äôt see paying for reduced or limited access.

title: Very good app
review: I think sleep and mental health is very important so I like that part of the app. On the other hand I wish when you enter the week free trial, the app automatically chose the 1 week subscription, not the 1 year. That aside, the app is nice, the voice actors and stories are awesome so 4/5.

title: LOVE the Calm App!
review: It gives me just what I need in the time I want. If I just have 1-2 minutes, I can do a check on what I‚Äôm grateful for. If I can‚Äôt fall asleep, the sleep stories are perfect! If I have a bit longer, I can do a meditation.

title: Recommend, but extremely annoying
review: This app is great for dealing with stress. It would be five stars if it didn‚Äôt have two thing. One, it will ask you to allow it to send reminders to you. Don‚Äôt do it. Two, almost nothing is free. It will ask for premium. This app need to be free or it will fail.

title: Nope.
review:
I downloaded Calm because my dad died I an accident before I was born, and my mom is dating. when she kisses her boyfriend it reminds me of my dad. So it makes me stressed. 
I did the first meditation session, it was good, but then I went to the second one... oh right, you have to pay to be not stressed.
I understand the premium is how y‚Äôall make money, but it‚Äôs not fair. Most of the content is locked, but you have to pay to get it.
I am one of those millions of people out there who have stress. So I deleted Calm and downloaded Headspace. 
Headspace has sooooo much more free content, and it has workouts and things called energy shots to wake you up. 
Headspace: 5 stars
Calm: 2 stars
Sorry:)

title: The Best
review: I  have a very difficult time falling asleep due to rheumatoid arthritis. I hoped this would just relax me; however, every time I use it, I fall asleep before the sleep story is even half over.  Wow what great results. This is worth every penny!!

title: Nothing is free
review: I really wanted to try this app but there‚Äôs no way to do so without signing up. I found one meditation but that was all. There‚Äôs a 7 day free trial but you have to subscribe and then cancel or you can get it for a cheaper price in the email you get but then there‚Äôs no 7 day trial, you pay up front. If there‚Äôs a way to use this app for free without giving permission to charge my card I‚Äôd love for someone to let me in on the secret.

title: Just got premium, do it!
review: I love this app! It‚Äôs amazing. I promise, just start using it and you will notice a huge difference in your meditation practice. Especially if you are a novice, this is a great tool to use to relax your mind and body.

title: Much more than I ever thought it would be
review: I really enjoy this app it comes in handy when stressed,  love the music and and sounds of nature.  I will use this app on a daily basis forever!!  Thank you so much for this.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for over 3 years and it brings such a sense of peace. The sleep stories, daily mediations and calming music and so much more truly help me. This app is constantly improving and I recommend this to anyone and everyone I can.

I‚Äôm in a free trial period. After the first night I realized it‚Äôs not for me. I have tried everything to unsubscribe. Their Apple subscription page doesn‚Äôt have an UNSUBSCRIBE link, their app won‚Äôt let you unsubscribe. In 7 days they will charge me $69. I am NOT CALM ANYMORE!

I just had to ask Apple help to unsubscribe Calm for me. The agent told me Calm is a Third Party purchase so I wasn‚Äôt able to unsubscribe through my Apple ID account.

It‚Äôs shameful that an app that is supposed to provide stress relief sneakily takes $70 from you just for trying it out. I got this because I was stressed and cried when I realized how much money they took. What a heartless trick and a sick business model. If your app is great, why would you need to trick people?

title: Beware Free Subscription!!!
review:
Pay close attention if you try free subscription, you will automatically be charged even if you cancel. You will need to request refund through Apple, Calm is not responsible for billing on iOS. You will need to complete unsubscribe within 30 days after you are charged and fight with Apple for refund.

Calm has no customer support through iOS.

title: Great App, but content is being reduced....why?
review:
Calm, 

Thank you for the excellent app. My favorite feature of this app ha sling been the calming scenery you can easily put on full screen on your tv and leave playing In the background for a more focused, productive exercise routine or work day. However, about 4-5 weeks ago, the available scenes changed. There are 13 options, but where there used to be abstract themes that enabled meditative practices, and sun-beams, the new ones are all nature focused. Is there any chance the old ones are coming back in a future update? Thanks in advance. 

All the best, 

T

title: Life-changing
review:
I‚Äôve never written a single app review before but this one has helped me so much that I thought it only right to share my experience. About a year and a half ago I started going to a therapist for depression, anxiety, and general mental health issues. In that very first meeting with her she told me to take a proactive approach and a good way to do that is to try this app. She recommended buying the premium version and I did and honestly that was one of the best decisions I‚Äôve ever made regarding my mental health. Now, I‚Äôm not going to sit here and say that my mental health issues are gone or that this app was a miracle cure. In fact, that‚Äôs far from the truth but I will say I use this app every single day and they‚Äôre constantly updating the content on there so that there‚Äôs something for pretty much anyone. The user interface is incredibly easy to use and you can always find whatever you‚Äôre looking for and they have a ton of options so you can try whatever looks cool. Meditation doesn‚Äôt work for everyone and that‚Äôs important to keep in mind before investing. However, if you think this app will even help you a little bit and you have 10 minutes every day to spare then I promise you won‚Äôt regret it. 
If you‚Äôve gotten this far into the review and you‚Äôve liked what I‚Äôve had to say so far then I might as well share my routine. I try to do the ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù everyday which is always a 10 minute guided meditation and it‚Äôs different everyday. There are also so many short meditations to chose from and some of them can be for specific emotions or situations which can also be really helpful. Having an anxiety disorder (or really a disorder of any kind) makes it incredibly difficult to think in present time and focus on the present moment, but the meditations on here have made that less of an obstacle. The thing about meditation is that it grounds you while you‚Äôre doing it, but it also trains your brain to stay grounded in your daily life as well and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so often used to treat mental health issues and that‚Äôs why it works. 
I also use the app when I go to bed because they have sleep stories, meditations for bedtime, music, and white noise sounds that will play until you tell the app to stop. The section on sleep is probably my favorite part of the app because getting a healthy amount of sleep used to be a huge issue of mine and now my sleep schedule has gotten so much better. Honestly if all of the other meditations didn‚Äôt exist I probably still would‚Äôve bought the app solely because of how much it‚Äôs helped me sleep! That‚Äôs truly how awesome this section of the app is.
In conclusion, what are you waiting for? Get this app!

title: So calming (I‚Äôm guessing that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs called calm)
review: So I‚Äôve only just turned nine but I have trouble falling asleep at night. Not because I‚Äôm worried or anxious or anything but my mind races with thoughts. I like to read for a while at night because I heard it was relaxing but when I put it down to fall asleep but I can‚Äôt because I get caught up in the story. I‚Äôm not saying no one should read at night. I just have a lot of trouble falling asleep. My mom got this app. (I don‚Äôt really know why because I‚Äôm not a lot of trouble but on the other hand my brother really is.) And I kept seeing ads for it so when this pandemic started I just tried it. The pandemic really got me off schedule. When we were still in school waking up at 6:45 AM was easy cause I was able to fall asleep at 9:00 PM but now during the pandemic we were able to wake up at 9:00 AM and I wouldn‚Äôt fall asleep till really late. Anyway enough about me more about the app. Your probably thinking this review is trash but just wait I‚Äôm gonna talk about the app. So the app is amazing even without the premium subscription. I started a while ago so you can take my word for it. I loved this app the second I started it but day after day I used it and grew to love it so much. My very first one was taking breaths and focusing and your breathing and just your breathing. I was trying to fall asleep that night but couldn‚Äôt but after I did that right when my head hit the pillow I was asleep. This is the best calming meditation app you could own. Don‚Äôt delete it if you didn‚Äôt like your first one. Try another and another I know you will love it. Get this app. You will have no regrets.

title: Part of my daily routine.
review:
Let me begin by saying I wasn‚Äôt always open to meditation. I am a meat and potato eating red-blooded American who lives in a small logging town. I work as a professional firefighter in a larger city about an hour from where I live. We workout, eat healthy, get annual physicals and do all kinds of things for our body‚Äôs health. How much do you do for your mind? The calm app is now part of my daily routine to help keep things running well between the ears. 
     I especially like the Calm app for its variety of teachers. This app is great for the practice of meditation and it has the benefits of sleep stories and sounds as well as other features. I found the ‚ÄúHow to Meditate‚Äù series by Jeff Warren very helpful in learning this new skill. Even if you aren‚Äôt a true beginner there are benefits to following his curriculum in learning how to take better advantage of other courses you do. 
     If you‚Äôre interested in mediation theory there are other apps that may be more interesting for you. Being able to take guidance from multiple teachers (which some other apps do not do) is an aspect I enjoy. 
     Try the free trial on all of the major mediation apps and decide for yourself. I‚Äôm happy I did. They all have a little bit different way of introducing you to guided meditation and they all helped me become more mindful. However, Calm is the app I chose to continue with, and an confident in recommending it to my friends and family. This is not to say the other apps don‚Äôt work or aren‚Äôt good platforms. I encourage you to find one you like and stick with it for a few months. 
     My only critique for the app is that I‚Äôd enjoy a section that explains the science behind what we‚Äôre practicing and how it benefits us. I‚Äôd like to see this section have both shorter lessons about what we‚Äôre actually doing and what we‚Äôre trying to accomplish, as well as longer discussions between experts similar to a podcast. It‚Äôd be cool if it were more interactive where I could share mediations with other people who have the app, similar to sending a pin on Pinterest or sharing a photo with my wife in the DM of Instagram.

title: Calm has changed my life üòå
review: I won‚Äôt make this too dramatic. I live a good life and am generally a happy person, and still I always felt like I was carrying so much stress (and honestly for no reason better than anyone else). Despite my attempts to lower stress through exercise, a healthy diet, and time outdoors, I always found those techniques to be short-term solutions (I still do all the above in tandem with Calm by the way). I finally tried Calm after hearing and reading such positive reviews. Calm has not only met but exceeded my expectations. It definitely takes a personal commitment, but carving out even just 10 minutes for the Daily Calm has completely altered my mindset in just a few weeks. In few instances do I now use the word ‚Äústressful‚Äù to describe my day. Taking stock of my daily feelings and thoughts through a quick 1-minute reflection is enough for me to get in touch with what I‚Äôm most anxious about or grateful for. And then the meditations themselves are enjoyable, plentiful and highly effective! The quality is exceptional as well. I absolutely love the narrators, the categories (including bedtime stories, soundscapes, music, and traditional meditations), and the overall peace of mind that comes with this wonderful program. $70/year is so worth the price! Of course Calm is just the tool. You‚Äôre the one who will have to come to the table with an open mind and a ready heart willing to do the work, but doing so will yield tremendous value! The world will be a better place if everyone took 10 minutes for the Daily Calm. Thank you to this wonderful team for changing my life in such a small bit meaningful way every day!

review: the guided meditations are wonderful, and it‚Äôs aesthetically enjoyable, with great features. what seems to be lacking the hardest, however, is diversity. it‚Äôs regular contributors are starkly white, and the few people of color seem to be back shelved, or just stock images. this is disheartening, esp with mindfulness‚Äô origins in east asia. i‚Äôm eager to find somewhere with more wealth of different voices and people once my subscription expires.

This app is too expensive  at $70.  I tried to get a refund and feel like I‚Äôm going circles.  I canceled my subscription just not worth the money. Especially if you are not currently working.  Good luck with getting your money refunded.

title: Best therapy I have
review: So I really struggle with my mental health... after not pairing well with my first therapist, being denied by my second and no one taking new patients after that...  I felt lost and alone. My mental health took a downward spiral during covid and recently even worse due to the holidays. I suffered a lot of abuse and trauma at the hands of my parents so the holidays are particularly hard for me. Anyways, I landed myself in the ER twice surrounding thanksgiving and felt 100% out of control... it was the worst I‚Äôve been mentally in a really long time. I‚Äôve had the calm app downloaded on my phone for years, but never purchased the premium... until recently when I experience a panic attack so horrible, I was convinced my heart would stop beating any moment. I immediately purchased the premium and used the SOS meditation. Since then, I‚Äôve been meditating every night. I can‚Äôt begin to tell you what this has done for me... I lost myself in 2020 when I lost everything else. My fianc√© and I canceled our wedding. Lost thousands of dollars. Lost our jobs. Fianc√© had to get an emergency hysterectomy. It was a horrible year. But calm is helping me end this year with some control in my hands. I‚Äôm not fully there yet but I‚Äôm already feeling like I have more of a grasp on controlling my body. I‚Äôm so thankful to the creators of this app and I‚Äôm thankful that you‚Äôve made it so affordable (in comparison to other mental health apps that profit a lot on that community). I know it‚Äôs not 10 dollars cheap, but it‚Äôs worth it... even if you can‚Äôt afford the annual membership, at least get the monthly one and give yourself the chance to breath. You deserve to feel in control.. thank you again for what your app is doing for me. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Like therapy in my pocket!
review:
I have suffered from severe panic disorder, GAD, depression, and OCD since age 12 (I am 30 now). I have been in therapy since then, but I am only able to afford it on a biweekly basis, when in reality I need support weekly if not more. My therapist recommended this app to me while in the midst of a relapse last year, and I downloaded it figuring if I didn‚Äôt like it I could just cancel after the free trial. I didn‚Äôt expect much.

This app is a literal GODSEND for people struggling with mental illness. The 7 Days of Calming Anxiety and 21 Days of Calm have been lifesaving programs for me. I repeat them as needed and they are a great supplement to my regular therapy sessions! I feel immediately so relaxed after practicing them, even if I was in the midst of a 5 alarm panic attack right before that. At night and on weekends when I don‚Äôt have access to a mental health professional, or in between sessions, this is a lifesaver. It‚Äôs like having therapy in your pocket. Not only is Tamara‚Äôs voice incredibly soothing, but she takes the time to actually explain anxiety and how it works, which makes me feel less alone or less silly and reassured me when I‚Äôm feeling crazy bodily symptoms. 

For people saying that it‚Äôs expensive: I understand 80 dollars a year is not something all of us have, especially in times like these, but when you really think about the cost of therapy per year, this is a much more affordable and helpful option in a pinch. Best money I‚Äôve ever spent, especially during uncertain times like these.

title: Fantastic app but lacking in one key area
review:
I love this app. I wear IEMs (In Ear Monitors) when I sleep to help me relax and stay asleep. I tried Luther apps but never found one that fit my needs. Either the guided meditation was lacking or the sound quality of the music/nature sounds was horrible. I found Calm and everything was great. I did the 7 day free trial and loved it. The $69/year subscription price is a bit of a sticker shock. (Everything is a subscription today and if you aren‚Äôt careful you can subscribe yourself into bankruptcy.) Fortunately they offered a discount that was low enough that I decided to give it a shot for a year. I have be using it pretty much daily for almost two months. There‚Äôs a guided meditation for just about any need. There‚Äôs high quality music and nature sounds are high quality and sound fantastic through my expensive IEMs. The sleep stories are a great feature. I feel like I am getting better sleep. All around the best app of it‚Äôs kind. 

Now to where it falls short. There‚Äôs no way to customize your user experience. It‚Äôs Calm‚Äôs way or no way. Yes their way is great and works well most of the time. They have playlist but there‚Äôs no way to customize them to meet my individual needs. This was a dealbreaker for me at $69/year so I‚Äôm not sure I will renew when my annual subscription is up. What would make this the perfect app would be to customize my sleep experience. I want to be able to create a custom playlist (or multiple custom playlist) to last throughout the night. Yes, I know that many of the music tracks are an hour long and you can set a sleep time that will repeat the track for hours but you are still repeating one track. I want the ability to start with a sleep story then have it play music the rest of the night. Maybe I want one track that will help me fall asleep, another track or 2 that will help me stay asleep and a track that is a little more upbeat to help me wake up refreshed. That should be something included in a subscription of this price. 

One final ‚Äúnice to have‚Äù would be profiles. The annual subscription price would be much easier to swallow if I could have a separate profile for myself, my wife and my kids each with our own playlist.

title: Real, logical and compassion help, right here
review:
Im a PhD with three Ivy league degrees, one in philosophy‚Äîthe stark Anglo-American genre which seemed to give no credence to anything not provable in the logical positive sense. I‚Äôm also a Skeptic by nature. Therefore, when many I am close to encouraged me to try mindful-fulness, although I witnessed changes for the better it brought about in their outlooks and real time personal and professional success, i just did not think it would speak to me. Reaching baby boomer age, I also viewed this as in the sphere of millennials. When I wanted to reduce my stress, I‚Äôd usually run, or jog;  play squash, or virtual tennis. I am a strong woman, an ethical and moral hard-worker for deserving causes, but have been historically hard on my self (and those close to me) for what I gauge as my shortcomings.
Calm has taught me physical and mental methods that have allowed me, over the past two years of listening to selections as they speak to my inner hopes and struggles, and the heartbreaks occurring in the greater world and personal sphere, which include a family death from Covid-19‚Äîhow to go through and to an extend get past grief, how to stop panic when it starts, how to use focus on breathe tp calm like musical meter.

Calm, Tamara‚Äôs education insights and the practices she walks through with us, are humanism as much as spirituality. Strange and mystical thoughts are not propounded. She gets you in touch with your heartbeat, the exhale, the tense shoulders, which in relaxing, next push clutter and disturbances from the mind, putting worry in perspective.  from the mind. 
Giving us the chance to lift ourselves up, in so doing we are then able to ease others‚Äô concerns both about our fluctuations between worry and hopefulness, and encourage hope in them ,for themselves

title: To Go To App To Chill
review:
I really enjoy all the different portions of this app. The sleep stories for the most part are really good, especially the travel ones. There are some that are a bit too much meant for a child and others like Harry Styles that are too romance novel type. He‚Äôs great as far as a VO but the writing is too much like a fantasy going to sleep with him. A little too personal. 
The section with inspirational people are awesome like Lebron James or the interview type with different people is great for a new perspective. The one on the 30 day meditation was nicely done.
The daily calm segments need improvement. It‚Äôs starts and ends with the same instructions and always with the same VO. Please have options of a different talent. She sounds contrived and needs to switch it up so there‚Äôs more of a message and not the same words. If there could be a choice to try a different person besides Tamara it would be better. She comes across as insincere or she‚Äôs getting distracted by the sound of her own voice in the headphones. I find it hard to get though it and have. Any times just avoided this part altogether because I don‚Äôt like the snarky tone of her delivery. The segment is too short to end it with ‚Äò come back to the room, wiggle your toes‚Äô phrasing. That‚Äôs something you might say after a long yoga session. It‚Äôs a quick message. Perhaps not wearing headphones might help her to not force a voice tone or change her speaking into a natural speaking voice. 
The ambiance water sounds after the segments are a nice touch. A great way to fade out of them. Leaving them on longer would be appreciated like a relaxing white noise. 
Adding more on breathing meditations but overall it‚Äôs a great app. Keep up the good work. I‚Äôm a fan.

title: needs to include diverse experiences
review:
I‚Äôm a POC who loves using Calm for sleep and anxiety. Recently, I‚Äôve been hosting meditation sessions using Calm for a group of people everyday - the variety of topics covered is awesome!

How Calm could do better: it seems clear from the content of the meditations that there is a certain type of person that is expected to be listening to these - someone who is completely able bodied, and has a generally comfortable life, but does face stress over day to day happenings. The language used in meditations can be isolating to those who do not have those experiences. (for example, the meditation in gratitude for your body often talked of feeling gratified that you could see - because some people can‚Äôt. Why is there an assumption here that blind people don‚Äôt meditate?)

Further, there are topics that people of color or those in the lgbtq+ community grapple with that seem glaringly missing. For example, how do you use mindfulness deal with anger or trauma from the stress of violence or micro aggression? How do you use meditation have pride in who you are, if you are different from others? How do you grapple with wanting to make a difference in the world but knowing you can‚Äôt change everything? If you are white, how do you navigate guilt or shame and then these feelings into action? How can you feel gratitude when you are going through a major illness? These are all big questions, many of which are a part of my life, but it feels like the assumed listener of Calm only worries about day to day work and basic relational questions, as those are usually the examples provided. I believe meditation can be transformational in navigating the emotional complexity of these experiences, and not just a tempory/trivial feel-good activity, but I think work has to be put in if Calm can actually lead that transformation.

title: Functionality isn‚Äôt at a $70 level
review:
The fact that there isn‚Äôt a way to control the volume from within the app blows me away. And the fact that no one else is talking about it in the reviews blows me away EVEN MORE. For this much money you would think that in-app volume would be a given. This was made specifically for sleeping and knowing the majority of people use their phones as an alarm clock, it would only make sense to have this as an option. But with the way the app is now, if you turn the volume down so the app isn‚Äôt blasting a narration or sleep sounds at full volume, you‚Äôre ALSO turning the volume of your alarm clock down. After taking the risk and turning the volume down and missing my alarm a few times, I learned my lesson and had to stop using the app at night. So it became useless to me until I went out and bought an actual alarm clock so I could start using the app again.

The other thing that is frustrating is that the timer doesn‚Äôt work for the music. I have a hard time staying asleep so I like to have the sleep music playing all night long to keep me in that trance-like state. But whenever I try to use the timer to keep it playing for 8+ hours, it never registers and the music stops playing after the 30 minutes. Every. Single. Time.

Normally I wouldn‚Äôt care this much and just move on and not take the time to write a review. But since I had to spend $70 on the app plus $25 on an alarm clock, I‚Äôm just a litttttttttttttle annoyed. Just a lil (a lot). Anyway, that‚Äôs all. Now time to try to sleep and stopped getting stressed about an app called CALM. Oh, the irony.

title: Miss the old Calm
review:
I‚Äôve had this app for years and used to love it. Unfortunately, I now find myself about to delete it and wanted to share some feedback from a now former user before I did. 

When I first got Calm, it had a handful of features unlocked. A few stories, several music/soundscape options. They were great. The premium options were tempting. I was considering buying the premium service though it was hard to justify it considering the plethora of other services available out there. Was Calm better than alternatives? Arguably, yes. Is it that much better to justify the high cost of admission? That was something I was on the fence about. I was willing to give it more time and see. In the meantime, I sung its praises it to a room full of women during a discussion on self-care, meditation, and stress management. I was a fan.  

Now, however, I find that everything on the app is now locked down and only available with the Premium subscription. I no longer have any options left making it worth the storage space on my phone. Where once the Premium subscription was tempting, it is now just off-putting. Apps that have no usability without subscription are immediately deleted on my phone. I gave Calm a little more time out of loyalty for a product I once loved. I‚Äôm not angry. I‚Äôm not trying to say that you shouldn‚Äôt have a premium service option. I just wish you still had some usability available like you used to. While you are good, there are other options out there for me that won‚Äôt cost me $$ every year. I wish you the very best and am sad to be parting ways, but I just can‚Äôt justify spending that kind of cash every single year. Thanks for the memories.

title: 5 star app but ...
review:
I love calm enough to buy the lifetime membership.  The offerings  and selections in various categories are such that one could never be bored.  This app is a true service to those who are in need for mindfulness to quite the mind, soothe the soul, sort out one‚Äôs emotions and bring some much needed sleep with its library of sleep stories that are so captivating, I often wish I could stay awake to hear the end but that would defeat the point of the sleep story. 

My only concern is that once in a while, not often enough to be a problem, the app ‚Äúforgets‚Äù I have a lifetime membership and entreats me to sign up as if I have no subscription.  I was taken to a page to do a free 7 day trial and nowhere on this page was there an opportunity to choose to sign in or reset my password. 

I‚Äôm not sure why the app drops my membership or subscription status but it would be less troublesome if the option to login and/or reset my password was also offered with the ‚Äúsubscribe ‚Äú offer.  My best guess as to why this happens is the app is triggered by the time of year I would subscribe if I had an annual plan which I had before switching to lifetime membership but still would like to see password reset and login options. This would make sense because my email address is retained in accounts page. 

This though is a minor issue,  so still a 5 star app for me because it is well thought out in organization and abundant in both quality content and options.   

Continue the excellent work.

title: AMAZING App, no difficulties
review:
I love the app daily calm. There are so many amazing things about it, but here is a summarization:
Before I got this app, I seriously had sleeping problems. Like, it would take me and hour to fall asleep! So, I got this app, and it seriously helps me out with stuff, like I started listening to some of the sleep stories on here, and I fall asleep before the story ends every. Single. Time!!! There‚Äôs even a ‚Äúback to sleep‚Äù thing that helps you fall back asleep if you wake up in the middle of the night randomly. (Which I find myself doing quite often)
Secondly, I also have some major anger problems. Like, I will scream over the littlest things. Sometimes, doing the breathing exercises in the app really helps me out with that and doing some of the meditation stuff on here helps with that as well. Also, I have the subscription on this app, which is TOTALLY worth it. It gives you access to more things I‚Äôm pretty sure, and it‚Äôs not way too much to handle. But then of course, I don‚Äôt know what the app is like without the subscription so if you don‚Äôt get the subscription I don‚Äôt know what to promise you. All I know is that with the subscription you get access to all of the different meditations, sleep stories, breathing exercises, etc... for 0$, as in completely free. So if you get the subscription, there‚Äôs that. 
Also, this isn‚Äôt one of those apps where it makes you rate the app right as you get it. Seriously, all these 5 star ratings are because it actually works. Also, if you are trying to go to sleep on this app at night, I recommend putting your phone on night mode and turning the darkness all the way down. (Because screens affect your sleep)
Overall, I highly highly recommend this app, and really hope that you end up getting it. ( especially if you are trying to solve sleep problems or just needing to relax ) 
By the way, this is NOT a manager or employee or something for the calm app. This is a middle schooler who just seriously loves the app. Bye!
