title: Be aware!  unintentional automatic subscription!
review:
My rating is not to do with the quality of the app.  ( I would give it at least 4 stars) I do however feel I was tricked into being charged a full price yearlong subscription. I downloaded the app from the App Store.  I was looking for an app to help me calm down and help with my sleep.  I will say, this app is exactly what I would have subscribed too on purpose after using my free 2 week trial.  At firstI thoughtI could look at the app quickly before starting my free trial.  That is not how it works.  By opening it,I started me free trial.  Moreover, by starting that free trial,  I did not realize that unless I turned off auto renewal, I would automatically charge my itunes associated credit card for a full price($69) full year subscription.  Unknowing, after it seemed like twoweeksfreetrial should be over, I wondered why I was still able to open the app. I HAD recieved from them an offerto buy the app at $49( or maybe it was closer to $45), but I did not accept that offer, still unaware that I was about to be charged full price for app instead!   I asked questions online and also looked at the contents of app and finally found my account info.  That is how I discovered that I was charged for full price, full year subscription!  I see that one can also just join for a month at a time.  That is what I would have chosen to do as a subscriber, but I was not given that choice.  My choices were hidden in the app in my account info.  I believe that is a deceptive practice.  When I tried to get help, my only choice to communicate was not fruitful.  All I got in response was an automated answer that said I had no recourse, nor any live person to talk too.

So basically I am saying, if you download the app from itunes app store, you are starting your two week free trial. And most importantly, you are committing toroll that over intoa full priced yearlong subscription after that.  If i had not changed my Calm settings AND if I do not check the charges monthly on that credit card, I could havebeen paying yearly automatically the rest of my life!  Calm of course does not take responsiblity for their app if you downloaded it from App Store.  I honestly didnt know there was any other way to download it.  

So Be Aware!

title: Life changing app!
review:
I‚Äôve been using this app daily for about 2 years and it is life changing!  Every few months I find something else to love about it. 

I‚Äôve struggled with lifelong insomnia, ADHD brain that won‚Äôt let me sleep, being a light sleeper, and then most recently with anxiety after the loss of a family member. 

I started using it because of the sleep stories. I still use them 2-4 times a week.  They are just interesting enough to get me to pay attention but there is no climax to the story, so you eventually drift off. While my favorite narrator is Tamara Levitt, I also enjoy Stephen Fry and most anyone with an accent.  For a little fun, the teacher from Ferris Bueller reads an incredibly dry textbook. Once the story is finished (usually 15-30 minutes), it can transition to the Scene of your choice or simply shut off. I prefer to transition to a scene as I‚Äôve always needed background noise to sleep. I rarely notice as I‚Äôm usually asleep by the end of the sleep story. 

Every single night, I use one of the sleep scenes. The sunset ocean is my favorite. Sometimes I even watch it to help my brain slow down, but I listen to it all night every single night. 

For the last few months, I‚Äôve been enjoying the music as I wind down for the night. Since I started working from home during Covid19, I‚Äôve started listening to the music for work. I‚Äôve found that with my ADHD, it really helps my mind focus on the task at hand. 

There are so many other features that I‚Äôve barely sampled like guided meditations and ASMR, but I‚Äôm thrilled with this app as is. 

If I had ONE suggestion to make, it‚Äôs that the developers add the Train Ride from Soundscapes to the Scenes. Listening to a train story with it fading to the sounds of a train ride for the rest of the night would be amazing!

This has truly been a life changing app, and I would like to take the time to thank the developers, musicians and narrators for helping me so significantly for the last couple of years. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever thanked an app developer before, but then I‚Äôve never used such an amazing app!!!

title: Holy macrarony! If you want a frickin app to fall asleep to THEN BUY THIS INE!
review:
As I already said, BUY THIS APP IF YOU NEED HELP SLEEPING! I had to personally go through at least four apps to be able to find one that always has stories to like listen to. I‚Äôm young and in middle school and have a few problems sleeping but it also gives me SO many ideas for my book I‚Äôm writing. I also zone out a few times because if I do you can her the person talking behind your thoughts and if your thoughts become negative, then just bring your mind back to this app. It is worth paying for! If I could give this app one hundred stars then so be it! 
One thing I wish they had was like E-books like a section for online books that you can go to when bored and read your self, with the narrator, or just listen to it. Also this idea would be good for trips like road trips or if your on a long plane flight. If they also had pod-casts or little factual stories that actually talks bout something like science or an animal, would also be cool.
BTW these ideas does not meant this app is any bad at all. It‚Äôs just a few ideas that could help improve things and help people feel better or have more uses of this app. By the way the stories are usually 20-40 minutes and the shorted is probally 11 minites. There is also a thing we‚Äôre you can like record your felling and like I enter like diary enters bout my feeling into the feeling thing and you can go back and see what yo felt three nights ago or a year ago. Pretty cool and so worth any money. ( not sure if this one was actually money or the other one that I tried and the other one sucked the stories were depressing from the other app this app is great)
All in all get it it‚Äôs worth it love it. GOD JOB CALM LOVE IT!

- Frost Lionwalker‚úåüèªü§çü§ç‚ùÑÔ∏èü§çü§ç

Btw I‚Äôm not so such if I‚Äôm writing a review to the app or about the app but I just did a combo of both so yeah love it! üòúüòÑüòÅ

title: Worth it but needs improvement
review:
I love this app. I loved the free version when I first downloaded it about two years ago and I haven‚Äôt been disappointed since purchasing a subscription more than a ago. I especially love the sleep stories. However it does need a couple of minor improvements.

1) I like the idea of the daily calm. I commend Tamara Levitt for compiling them for us. I just don‚Äôt like they way they‚Äôre laid out. Since each one is typically 10-11 minutes, I would like to focus on the subject that she is presenting during more of those 10-11 minutes. Each one is organized like so: 3-4 minutes of breathing discussion and/or body scan, 3-4 minutes of complete silence, 2-3 minutes of the subject matter that it is in the title, immediately followed by an ending to the meditation. The problem I have is that sometimes the only time I have to meditate is before bed. With the daily calm being set up this way, I fall asleep during the silent part before gaining the benefit of the information in the daily calm, then wake up annoyed later. If instead on the rare occasion I‚Äôm able to meditate earlier in the day, I often find myself literally fast forwarding to the 7+ minute mark to quickly listen to what‚Äôs being said, then try to make mental note of it to meditate on it later. I think less time should be spent on breathing and body scanning in the beginning, with only a very short break before going into the subject matter of the meditation so that more time can be spent on the meditation subject and then have the silent stretch before the ending comments. 

2) I love listening to the music options while I‚Äôm at work. I noticed some time ago that the music selections don‚Äôt have a repeat option. That‚Äôs fine for the ones that are an hour or more long, but for the shorter pieces that are only 10 minutes, it‚Äôs a little silly that I have to keep going back to the app to restart it while I‚Äôm working. But I haven‚Äôt looked into it lately so that might have changed already. 

3) I‚Äôm having issues with loading the scenes that have dark/light mode options. I like both the night time and day time versions of Jasper Lake in particular (whose dark and light mode options come with very different sounds) and I would like to be able to choose which one I‚Äôm listening to regardless of time of day and regardless of dark/light mode. I keep my phone and iPad in dark mode because it‚Äôs easier on my eyes but to get the version of Jasper Lake that I want, I have to switch modes and open and close the app several times before I get the one I want. 

Other than that it‚Äôs great. I was able to get a year‚Äôs subscription during a sale event. If those things aren‚Äôt fixed I might not be willing to pay full price next year. I guess it depends on how addicting those sleep stories get between now and then. üòÅ
developerResponse: {'id': 6598106, 'body': 'Hi elocin2003, thanks for your thorough and honest review. For 1, we recently added a Sleep Timer to music, so I\'ll see if we can do something similar for the Breathe Bubble. For 2, I passed your feedback along. For 3, all Calm Music and Soundscapes have an Auto Play button that you can set for it to repeat a single track, repeat a list of tracks in a tag, or have no repeat. For a single track to loop, you want to tap the autoplay icon until you see a "1" in the center of it. Thank you so much for subscribing and I hope you have a wonderful new year. - Josh', 'modified': '2018-12-29T03:49:51Z'}

title: Life changing
review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for three weeks now. I can say with utmost sincerity that this app has changed my life. With everything going on, including the panic inducing CA wildfires in my back yard, I finally reached a breaking point. I‚Äôve had multiple panic attacks in the last 6 months that cripple me for days. Depression symptoms were persistent. I was to the point where I called the National Suicide Hotline. Everything felt overwhelming and out of control. I felt there was no way forward. 

This is no more. 

I contacted a therapist via my HMO, Kaiser. She told me I could get the app for free for a year through my insurance. I assumed it would just be basic, with a handful of disappointing guided meditations. I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong. 

I am now on day 18 of the How To Meditate series. I am learning every day how to strengthen my mind in the face of adversity and the unknown. I can‚Äôt recall anytime in my life that I have felt so grounded and in control of my emotions. The previously impossible now feels possible. I have hope. I feel like an unshakable mountain when faced with adversity. 

And this is in less than three weeks. 

I am so passionate about the power of meditation that I now want to teach it to everyone. Meditation is the pathway to sanity. And this app gives you more than enough tools to make it a part of your daily life. The instructors, the variety, the music! Honestly, I live in this app now. 

Thank you, Calm. You truly changed my life. My gratitude is overflowing. Everyone needs this app. Everyone.

title: Meditating isn‚Äôt for people like me - the sad ones.
review:
I‚Äôve heard about meditation for years, and whenever I‚Äôd Google it, there were always images of smiling, happy, fit people - sitting in their perfect homes with gorgeous views of lakes, or on the beach in a bikini with a huge smile.  

Totally not me. I‚Äôm in my 30‚Äôs, I‚Äôm not miserable (but not smiling all the time), my house is fine, but no lake view. The last time I was at my goal weight was when I was a newborn. I assumed you had to go into meditation happy and healthy already so I checked that off of my list along with ‚ÄúHotel Receptionist‚Äù and ‚ÄúAdvanced Yoga‚Äù. 

But out of sheer desperation, after a scary plunge back into a depressive state, I was desperate to try anything. I wanted my brain to turn the heck off. So after scrolling Instagram for images of more people doing life right, I saw a trusted friend of mine mention Calm and decided to try it. 

I sat down on my floor beside a box of ice cream cake that I had just eaten, turned off my ‚ÄúHeartbreak‚Äù playlist, threw in some ear buds, and did a guided meditation. 

Long story long, I‚Äôve had Calm as an app for coming up on 2 years. I‚Äôve had about 135 days that I‚Äôve done meditation. It‚Äôs a skill that needs to be learned, it won‚Äôt click overnight, but there‚Äôs no such thing as a ‚Äúbad‚Äù session. I love having the ability now to take a ‚ÄúBrain Time our‚Äù when my mind is racing. I‚Äôve noticed my anxiety levels drop. Depression still happens for me, but Calm is one of the sharpest tools in my Mental First Aid kit. 

If you‚Äôre a newbie or on the fence about meditation, I‚Äôd say to give it a whirl for a few weeks. Be satisfied and okay if you legit just sit with your eyes closed during that time and listen to Tamara (the voice behind Calm, which is, by far, the best voice I‚Äôve heard in Meditation apps).

title: Tamara Levitt - No thanks
review:
If she is the true author of many of these meditations & stories, she is brilliant. BUT I really wish there would be more options for readers to read her work instead of her reading it herself because unfortunately many of the people I know, myself included, cannot stand listening to the way she reads. It‚Äôs her voice, it‚Äôs the way she forces every word to have vocal fry. It‚Äôs the way she adds so much inappropriate emotion where it doesn‚Äôt belong. It‚Äôs strong enough to where you cannot focus and relax. She is not relaxing at all. It seems more like she‚Äôs intentionally trying to evoke reactions and is way out of place for meditation and sleep stories. Literally cannot stand it and so we‚Äôre missing out on so many of the options. For premium you‚Äôd think they could offer the option to swap readers for a lot more of them than you can. 

Edit- just to add more about how incredibly annoying Tamara Levitts voice is. I literally cannot stand to listen to her and when I accidentally click on something she does or since you have to open some of them up to figure out who‚Äôs reading one you have to actually start them and then have to listen for a second...and every time it‚Äôs her I actually cringe. She makes so many people uncomfortable the way she speaks I don‚Äôt know how they haven‚Äôt pulled her from being a reader. It really makes a huge portion of this app unusable. It‚Äôs unfortunate. Pleaseeeeeeeee Tamara, use your skills in another way for the app than being the voice behind any of it. Pleaseeee Calm, encourage her to think about having someone else read her material!

Edit some time later - seems like the app is always adding a more varied group of readers which is great üëç A suggestion would be to have the one male reader that‚Äôs behind much of the core material to also be used for at least some body scans. As of now all the body scans are Tamara...would be nice to have that option from a different reader too as this is some of the more used material and as you read above for many she is not an actual option to listen to. Another suggestion...would be really nice for info to be shown on the outside of a tab so you don‚Äôt have go open it up and then go into each entry to see A) if it is just one or maybe several readings B) what readers are available C) the length of the entries. 

Also just want to say that my intentions aren‚Äôt to be offensive regarding Tamara‚Äôs voice. I know I‚Äôve gone on and on about it, but it really is a big deal. Meditation is supposed to allow you to relax and it‚Äôs bothersome that huge chunks of this expensive app are actually unusable. I would be able to swallow it a bit better if I thought it was just my own personal thing I had about it, but knowing that so many feel the same way it‚Äôs frustrating they don‚Äôt work harder to make it better for everyone. They have to know. So that leaves me wondering if it comes down to a bruised ego or not wanting someone else to take/share her projects - whether it‚Äôs better for the listeners or not - because I believe she‚Äôs the/one of the founders and must have plenty of say in these matters.

title: Starting a free trial? Read this for a better experience.
review:
Just be careful with your free trial. I wanted to see if this app would be useful for me. Turns out, I rarely used it in my 7 day trial, which is actually more like 5 days since you MUST cancel 24 hours or before the 7 days or you‚Äôll be charged $70 for the whole year, which I failed to do. Nope, you don‚Äôt automatically get charged for a $15 monthly plan, you get charged for the whole year if you fail to cancel your free trial. Lovely! But whatever, my fault. At least I can ‚Äúcancel anytime!‚Äù

Ok, well here‚Äôs my rant on the ‚Äúcancel anytime policy.‚Äù Sorry to say, but canceling anytime is a little play on words. Sure, you can indeed ‚Äúcancel anytime‚Äù like the app says. However, it‚Äôs useless. Canceling 364 days before the subscription ends, like I was in the process of doing, and canceling 1 day before the subscription ends, results in the same charge. Yep, you‚Äôre still getting charged the $70 for the year even if you cancel, like in my case, 18 hours into the year‚Äôs subscription. 

So what should you take from this? Just cancel your 7 day trial after 5 days or you‚Äôll be charged. And if you still want to use the app after the trial, I would STILL recommend canceling and then buying the monthly plan, at least to start. Because if after 1-2 months you no longer like the app, you‚Äôre stuck with paying $70. If you still like the app after a couple months, then upgrade to the yearly plan, which is cheaper then paying for 12 individual months. (You do this in Apple‚Äôs settings > tap your name at the very top > tap subscriptions > tap the ‚Äúcalm‚Äù app. 

Ok class, there‚Äôs my lesson for the day. :)

title: Enjoy it, but it NEEDS IN-APP VOLUME CONTROL, not affecting my entire phone volume directly
review:
Let me start off by saying, I would give 5 stars and be completely over the moon ecstatic if it had IN APP VOLUME CONTROL. I purchased an annual subscription almost a month ago, and I have been using it daily. It‚Äôs very helpful in explaining how to mediate, guiding and teaching and the reasoning why it is so important. I mainly purchased it because I have daily struggles with falling asleep and staying asleep. I really do wish there was an option with volume control, this is a major issue for me! I have to turn the volume on my phone down, and if/ when I do fall asleep, I don‚Äôt wake up to my alarm or calls. 

Calm WOULD BE PERFECT and 100% better if there was the ability to change the volume of the voice on meditations and background sounds on the app alone, not having to change my entire phone volume! I have another sleep app that is free (with option to upgrade) with sounds to fall asleep to and it has ‚úÖa mixer, allowing me to not disrupt my phone volume, just controls the volume directly on the app. ‚úÖ I feel that there is no reason Calm should not have something like that. If I keep the volume at where my iPhone is already set to, it is extremely loud, to the point I can hear meditations or sleep sounds through earplugs! Because I mainly use this for sleep, this has been a HUGE ISSUE and I BEG THE DEVELOPERS TO IMPROVE THIS AND INCORPORATE an IN APP VOLUME CONTROL!!! Other than the volume issue, I really do enjoy Calm, but I do wish I would have done the free trial before purchasing an annual subscription. I don‚Äôt think I would have purchased, especially not an annual subscription, in retrospect. I definitely won‚Äôt renew if they don‚Äôt incorporate in app volume control.

Love it, it just NEEDS IN-APP VOLUME CONTROL!
To the developers, please please please do this!

title: I love it but I hate it.
review:
I love this app. I downloaded it almost a year ago in order to help me sleep better and that is exactly what it did. The calming background music to the simple sleep stories that I was able to listen to during my free trial made me fall in love and sleep a thousand times better.

However, I believe that the price at which we are being asked to pay is far too exclusive to a certain amount of people.

I am a high-school student graduating in May and I don‚Äôt have the money to pay for this app when all I‚Äôm trying to do is get educated and sleep good. I have stress coming from all angles and I have suffered from too many sleepless nights over the years and I just wish I could use this app a little more freely. Not full full access to 100% of commodities within the app, but a little more than we get now.  

When I first downloaded this app, I began to sleep amazingly. This was when I had full access during my free trial, but since it ended I have only been able to listen to ‚ÄúBlue Gold‚Äù by Steven Fry. 

What a fantastic piece it is, but simply making the free version a bit more fair would be nice. 

Possibly allowing ‚ÄúBlue Gold‚Äù to remain a permanent free story, but allowing other stories to circulate at random every 24 hours.

I would honestly love that. Even if I was unable to choose which sleep story to listen to, at least I would get something different everyday, y‚Äôknow?

In short I think making this app so heavily subscription based really isn‚Äôt fair to the people who are just looking for better, healthier, safer options for sleeping outside of medicine. 

The app is supposed to help people sleep better(among other aspects of life), so how can they do that if they don‚Äôt have the money to pay for it. 

This app is a straight jacket. Point blank. You either have the money and buy the subscription or you listen to ‚ÄùBlue Gold‚Äù a  hundred thousand freaking times to the point where you know the story word for word.

Know, I understand that the narrators and authors must be paid somehow, but it just doesn‚Äôt seem very fair to make this app so exclusive to only the people who can pay the already outrageous price for it.

It‚Äôs unfortunate that my review will be overshadowed by the majority of 5 star reviews because the price is not a problem for them.

BIG thanks to Calm for making a very much needed app only available to the people with the biggest wallets.

title: In case you need more Lebron James in your life...no thanks
review:
7 day trial with auto charge for $70 after. Except virtually EVERYTHING on homepage is locked. With a graphic of Lebron James on it? Are you serious? So I have to look at him every time I go to meditate? Nothing objectionable about Lebron specifically‚Äîit could be Betty White, Forrest Whitaker, Bruce Springsteen or the Dalai Lama‚ÄîI just really don‚Äôt want to be greeted by a celebrity EVER when I go to meditate. Getting away from celebrity and consumer culture is one of the reasons I meditate in the first place. I‚Äôm probably going back to Andy @ Headspace. He‚Äôs WAY less ‚Äúin your face‚Äù and I don‚Äôt feel like he‚Äôs trying to sell me the same junk I‚Äôm trying to escape from. 

Also, I was trying this app because I read that it was more suited to experienced meditators. Still can‚Äôt identify why anyone would say that. It seems very gimmicky. All I want out of a meditation app is some basic structure to help me stay on track. Not a Hollywood production. For example: How do I find a 20 minute meditation? Not 3, not 2 not 11.5. But AT LEAST 20 minutes. And I don‚Äôt need a ‚Äútheme‚Äù like a specific meditation is a prescription for some specific ailment. It‚Äôs not Advil. Can‚Äôt seem to find much ‚Äúmeditation value‚Äù in and amongst all the ‚Äúproduction value‚Äù flotsam.  

Another example: ‚ÄúTrain your mind‚Äù could be good. But either get Lebron James out of it or offer a similar series without that gimmick.  And ‚Äúrain on trees.‚Äù ‚ÄúCurated by Lebron James!?‚Äù You got an NBA personality to ‚Äúcurate‚Äù an audio loop of rain on trees? Do you know what ‚Äúcurate‚Äù means? Do you have anyone on staff who gets how cringey that is in a meditation app? If so you should listen to that person. It‚Äôs also insulting to your user‚Äôs intelligence but that‚Äôs another issue. 

And what‚Äôs with all the ‚Äú7 days‚Äù nonsense? Meditation isn‚Äôt an antibiotic regimen. This is just more ‚Äúlisticle‚Äù stuff that suggests that all problems can be solved with a grocery list. Stop reading Medium, and stop confusing meditation with ‚Äúproductivity culture.‚Äù They have almost nothing to do with one another. You need someone on staff who‚Äôs reading and helping incorporate REAL meditation technique, value and theory. 

Free marketing advice: A lot of people meditate in order to escape from and/or clear away the junk that assaults their consciousness all day every day. Don‚Äôt be part of the problem people are using your product to get away from. Simplify. Simplify. Simplify.

Pretty sure I‚Äôm going back to Headspace but I will poke around a bit more and see if I can find something worthwhile here. So far big thumbs down.

title: Non-existent customer support, animal rights violation
review:
I started using calm, based on the nature based meditations and sleep stories, but it seemed like they care more about quantity than quality and the app is terribly bloated, cumbersome to use with constant crashing created by developers who have no concern for performance and usability. Worst of all, agree with other posters on TrustPilot that the company seems to have the wrong attitude especially for a wellness / meditation app. The ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù is practically non-existent, condescending and useless!! No one cares about your issue or complaint on anything. 

I reported a sleep story where elephants are made to work, taking tourists around on a safari, even though the story claims they did them a favor by not riding on them (!) but mind you, still made to work for tourists and taken away from the wild and their families and herd to be our guides!

This is just promoting exploitation of wild animals, which are already having enough issues in their struggle to survive! If not curbed, who knows they might have a animal circus story next! 

This is horrendous for a wellness app or anywhere! Inspite of reporting, they didn‚Äôt even bother to take such content down and the ‚Äúcustomer support‚Äù was condescending in his tone when followed up to enquire what action has been taken!! 

Will definitely be taking this up further with animal rights organizations as they haven‚Äôt removed that content! 

These people should not be in the meditation business, which is so unlike headspace app and their culture, who model what they‚Äôre about! The whole app and set up feels much worse now with their horrible attitude! 

Most of their ‚Äústuff‚Äù isn‚Äôt good quality material and many of their narrators should not be narrators for sleep stories or meditation. This is the best example of what happens when meditation is taken over by business! This seems to create more despair than calm!

title: Not right
review: Here is this app that offers to help with sleep, anxiety, depression etc but every single thing on it is locked. So to be able to get anything from this app you have to pay for it, $69.99 a year. During these trying times it hard to afford a roof over my head and I have a lot of stress and suffer from insomnia. It would have been nice if a few things were open to use on this app. I saw only one story that was open‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs it! Ridiculous! I‚Äôm sure it helps people but what about ones who really can‚Äôt afford that $70 a year right now huh? You should have free stuff on there for people like me. Will be deleting this app and looking for a free one. I‚Äôm upset cause this looked like a good app that might have helped me in many areas but I guess money is more important than actually helping people. :(

title: Don‚Äôt download, automatically subscribes

title: Be aware! Horrible service.
review: Just downloaded for the ambient sounds one day and a week later they charged me 69.99 for a year subscription automatically. What company would even do that and feel like they care about the consumer? I get that I forgot I downloaded your convoluted app but why jump to a year charge versus maybe weekly or monthly. Feels like s scam and money grab. I canceled my subscription right away and now fighting the charges with Apple. For an app that promotes mental health it‚Äôs completely the opposite. Ridiculous and will get refunded.

title: Misleading
review: I am unable to cancel this app and locked into a year of payment. I‚Äôve used multiple features and nothing felt like a fit for me compared to meditation sessions I‚Äôve attended in person. People rave about the bedtime stories so I tried that instead, but still prefer reading books. It wasn‚Äôt clear to me that I wouldn‚Äôt be able to get out of the year payment, which is especially disappointing since the promo code I had didn‚Äôt work initially. I know this company is doing very well and has grown immensely, so I was hoping by now they would allow their customers flexibility in cancelling.

title: NOTHING IS FREE!!!
review:
I used to use this app awhile back. I remember having some free options to the soundscapes which I loved. I hadn‚Äôt used this app in awhile until a few days ago. Now nothing is free. 

Yeah it‚Äôs a great app if you pay. $14.99 a month to get calm but yet you don‚Äôt have the money to get calm- hence needing the app. 

I suggest allowing features to be be purchased individually at a lower cost if purchased just for that specific feature. (Example: soundscapes $2.99 a month) Boom more customers!

title: Not really free*
review:
You can download for free, but there isn‚Äôt much you can do after that without paying for it. I‚Äôve paid for 3 years and can‚Äôt this year. There was a lot more available when I first downloaded it. Seems like they‚Äôve stripped a lot of the free away.
If you can pay, however, it‚Äôs a great app. I‚Äôm struggling to make ends meet and this is something I had to skip out.

title: All the bad stuff
review: Over all this app is ok, I love the app in general what it is is awesome but there should really be more available for people that don‚Äôt want to pay $69.99 a year,  I kept getting my hopes up because I would find somthing that is free and it would be a playlist that only the introduction is free. I wish that I could do more but I can only find about 3-5 things that are free. Again the idea of the app is awesome I feel like if you made more available there would be more users, might delet soon.

title: False advertising.
review:
This app is falsely advertised as free. Received several ads for it in other apps, youtube, etc. all ads claimed that it was free. It is not. 

Decided to pay for it anyway. The supposed ‚Äòclinically proven‚Äô sleep meditation is not proven at all, and doesn‚Äôt work. 

Don‚Äôt waste your time and effort, you‚Äôre better off just using YouTube.

title: Tgfqieen  m
review: Oh lord

title: You have to pay to get access to 95% of everything on there
review: Saw good reviews. Really disappointed. You can look up better sleep meditations on YouTube for free rather than paying an unreasonable amount to actually get access to anything worthwhile on this app. Literally found three things you didn‚Äôt have to get premium to listen to and they weren‚Äôt worth downloading a whole app just to listen to.

title: Bait and Switch
review:
I used the ‚Äúfree Calm app‚Äù two times. There were plenty of choices at that time. A few weeks later, I went back on and there were hardly any choices. I kept being promoted to sign up for the premium version. I used my Spotify account and found many of the same resources (soundscapes, meditation practices, etc.) 
Not worth it for me.

title: Disappointed
review:
Ok, so I read the top review and got the app, thinking that there would be some locked things, but also a good amount of ink locked things. 

I was wrong. 

When I went to the music section, I could not find ANY music available free without having to pay. I scrolled through everything (in the music section) and could find nothing. NOTHING! 
I know, I know. You‚Äôre probably wondering: Why don‚Äôt you just listen to something else on the app? 
Well, the problem with that is that, me being an avid reader and a writer, the stories make my mind race as I think of plot twists and background stories *sigh*. I can‚Äôt do meditations either because they just don‚Äôt work for me. And I don‚Äôt like soundscapes because they get annoying to me. 

All in all, the app has great content for people willing to pay around $70.00 a year. Anyone else trying to listen to sleep music? Just go to YouTube or Spotify because I don‚Äôt think this app is worth it.

title: Stress cost money friend

title: Very pleased!
review:
CALM app, is a must for everyone! Kids, teens, men, women, it‚Äôs for all! 

Quick summary, early on in my marriage, I learned of my anxiety, after our first born I learned of my depression. Either of those alone aren‚Äôt easy to manage, then add the info below... Who wouldn‚Äôt need CALM in their life?

I am a mother to 7 children and wife. I never imagined having this many children, nor would I have guessed our ‚Äúfifth‚Äù pregnancy would turn out to be spontaneous triplets. 
 
The amount of changes in our life in such a small window of time, sent my struggle with Anxiety and Depression into a fast spiral of mental breakdown. After seeking professional help, my husband knew a bit of CALM at home, on the go and walking was needed for this mama! He decided (upon my request) this app was worth the investment and gifted it to me. Let me say... Seven children (triplets) on a small salary. 

I have really enjoyed the CALM app, it‚Äôs helped me in so many areas of my life. 
-My favorite part is the NEW content all.the.time! My other favorite is the meditation for beginners and pros. I have enjoyed learning how to meditate. The way husband describes it is, it‚Äôs teaching me how to go into my nothing box - like men. (YouTube: men and their nothing box.) Yes, yes, yes it does! I LOVE IT! Have you ever just wanted to silence the world or sit quietly in a crowded room and people watch!? Having no worry or care in the world about what is going on around you!? This app is so good at guiding you through your thoughts and feelings or allowing you the freedom to hear the wind in the trees, ocean sounds at sea, the crackling of fire and more. It‚Äôs amazing being taught how to slow down, love my inner self and sit listen to my own breathing. I definitely feel this app is for EVERYONE, especially for those struggling with mental and emotional thoughts. 

This app is pricey, but having had the app since 2018ish - till now; we have been sent many coupons from the creator to continue it - at great discounted rates. It no doubt saved us a lot of money in the long run by simply signing up once and paying the amount requested (they hook you up!). 

My only complaint is listening to female narrators. It‚Äôs so so so so so not my favorite! We need men narrators as a second option - more often! I‚Äôm not sure why or how, but the men narrators provide me more relief than the women. I definitely prefer listening to the calming voice of men in this CALM app. Hope this helps! üíú

title: Costly
review:
Everything is about money. LOTS of money.
I have no problem compensating a developer for creating an app. I don‚Äôt. But I would rather pay $5-$10 up front as was once the app way of doing business. No longer. The more popular the app, the more the money factor kicks in. Now, the app is ‚Äúfree‚Äù - free to download and free to access a few token features. ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù was a nice idea. Now it‚Äôs big business. And I mean BIG. Yeah, they have a ‚Äúfree‚Äù version but the vast majority of content will set you back $69.99 a year! They have celebrity narrators and of course THEY do nothing free. ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù is a big, growing company in costly San Francisco. Their mission statement says they ‚Äúwant to make the world a happier place.‚Äù That‚Äôs lovely. So do I. In my opinion, big companies like all of the digital companies in the Bay Area of California, don‚Äôt make the world a ‚Äúhappier place.‚Äù
It‚Äôs the little guys - the kitchen table creators that accomplish that. But once they get too popular, the lure of big money does them in every time. I will not pay $70 for a year sub or an even larger amount for a lifetime sub. I don‚Äôt need celebrities to calm me down. I am deleting my ‚Äúfree‚Äù app and looking for a smaller, more reasonably priced alternative. I suggest you do too. But by judging how many millions of people have already bought in and made ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù the next multi-billionaire corporation, I doubt many will listen. ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù can put all of the touchy-feely marketing descriptions they want on this app. They are still just another greedy profit motivated corporation. If you take just one thing from my review to remember, I hope it‚Äôs that last sentence. Thanks for reading.

title: From A Helping Professional

review: This is a GREAT app that just keeps getting better and better. I have been a fan for 4 years and it has come a long way since then. title: Can‚Äôt speak highly enough about it
review:
I‚Äôve been working 100 hour weeks for 3 years now and haven‚Äôt treated my body or mind well at all.

Downloaded this after one of the panic attacks I started getting in year 3 (I don‚Äôt have anxiety... just years of stress with little sleep) and never looked back. This platform has made mindfulness accessible to a much larger audience - nothing in here is ‚Äúnew‚Äù per se, the differentiator is in the breadth and depth of their practices, how clean and professional they are (no more risky clicks on YouTube), and how much variety is included.

There is music, guided meditation, stretching, stories, soundscapes and more that I haven‚Äôt even used yet. All of the material is tailored - for a certain level of user (neophyte to expert), a certain situation (stress, anxiety, sleep, city life, etc.), or a given amount of time.

This app is what you make of it. Take it from someone who has never practiced meditation before and even doubted it‚Äôs efficacy, an investment banker so focused on achievement that he abused his body and mind for years. This app is a lifesaver, maybe literally

And I did the free trial at first expecting to cancel before getting charged, but I‚Äôm excited to be a paying customer now. The quality of life improvement alone is more than worth it. If you‚Äôre already an expert and want to do your own thing, great - this app can augment your practice. And if you‚Äôre a beginner like me, this app is the perfect base of support you‚Äôll want to start taking this type of thing seriously.

title: Considering pricing structure, should be better
review:
The app is fine. Just fine. It has quite a few hiccups with audio pausing randomly (when using AirPods Pro on-hear controls), and this baffles me, as even cheaply made freemium apps have no problem with this.

My issue is with the content vs. pricing structure. The subscription is annual. That‚Äôs it. No monthlies or quarterlies. Annual, with a 7-day trial.

The problem is... this app still feels very much like it was released years ago, on a Verizon Droid phone (the ones with the big clock and weather on Home page). There is that suspicious, rough-around-the-edges ‚Äúlook and feel‚Äù that just screams ‚Äú2012!!!‚Äù

As for the content, most of it, except the Calm-exclusive stories and ambient sounds, is available on Spotify or Apple Music (or Deezer or etc etc etc). So you‚Äôre paying a flat $70 for an app that still feels like it is milking a business model created in 2016 (but it‚Äôs been 5 years), while also paying for that same content on your preferred music streaming service. Think about that for a moment, and now think about the pricing structure.

Imagine paying an annual fee for Safari (even if the fee were $50), so that you could ‚Äúask website not to track you.‚Äù That‚Äôs what this feels like at times.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong. The stories are nice. The ambient sounds are nice and high quality. But that‚Äôs it. I think a reassessment of both, the UI experience and products offered, and the pricing options, could go a long way. That is, if the execs at Calm Inc. still find their vision viable. I know I do, but not like this.

title: Charged me after I canceled my subscription
review: I barely used this app. I removed my subscription and deleted the app months ago. Now I see that I am charged $69.99. Even logged into the app it says I do not have a subscription. I am very angry about this.

title: I enjoyed the trial, but cannot relax to narrator's voice
review:
I finally tried calm! The sleep story ads I'd get on Youtube helped my anxiety at times, and now that I am practicing mindfulness and meditation consistently, I figured I'd download it to sort of help me get the basics. I can say I really enjoyed the "How to Meditate" series, and the layout is very pretty and simple, but that was all I could really get into. 
With all due respect, I found the main narrator's voice more distracting and bothersome than relaxing. I found myself getting slightly startled or jumping whenever she spoke up throughout meditations that were meant to help me sleep. This never happened with other guided meditations I've followed or with my hynotherapist, who've all had soothing voices. I tried changing narrator, as suggested by Calm, but on all of the meditations I've been using, there are no other voice options. 

Meditation aside, the other features on the app are nice, however, I can find soundscapes and peaceful music on Youtube, Spotify or other free soundscape apps. So while Calm is a great idea and clearly useful for many, I just can't say I feel it's worth continuing to pay for for me personally.

title: Complete joke of an app!
review: Like most things  like games and apps  theses days in the App Store unfortunately just for finding a app to help you relax  it too costs money! And this is not like a pay once done deal! Every freaking month you have to pay  an insane amount of money just for alleviating stress! It‚Äôs so laughably ridiculous since I thought the limited edition of the app would be better. I got this app since lately I have been feeling extremely anxious and stressed the past few months! I have tried everything without a single thing working. Like I have been unable to concentrate on my college work! My whole body gets ticklish like my arms and legs! I have been getting less sleep! Depression! You name it! When I saw this app I  thought this would finally break me free from my stress! Especially since there is no other app in the App Store which offers a variety of techniques to help me deal with the problems I have been dealing with lately! I enter the app and immediately get told most of the items are behind a paywall which is bad enough! But I find some items are available. So I think, Oh well I‚Äôll try those  instead. Today I tried the 7 days of managing stress session. The session was awesome! And I felt so relaxed and more focused after the first session! But to my anger I saw unfortunately even for the sessions which are available you can only do the first day!  The locks on those days which indicate the paywall are so barely visible I didn‚Äôt notice them until now at a closer glance.Thanks to this awful  realization my stress actually came back! My nerves flared! My ticklish feeling came back! And my mind became back to feeling restless! Ironic isn‚Äôt it you stupid devs?! I was so enraged to be played like this that I am immediately typing this review with hopes you will understand my frustration and anger and do something about this issue!!!!!

title: 5 stars prior to recent update where app won‚Äôt launch
review:
As of today, 2/15/21, the few days old update has caused the app to be unable to load. The main, ‚ÄúTake a deep breath,‚Äù screen simply remains up and app will not launch.

There have been numerous reviews posted stating this same thing about the latest update and we, your users (many of us, like myself, paid Premium users) are frustrated and the developers at Calm have not responded to a single review regarding this latest update which has caused the app to be rendered completely useless. At the very least, the developers at Calm should be responding to the myriad of disgruntled customers of the Calm app regarding when a fix update is to be expected, or if a fix is even being worked on. That‚Äôs just basic customer service 101. Yet, it‚Äôs nothing but radio silence from the Calm app developers. 

I am a Premium paid subscriber and have used, and loved, Calm for quite a number of years. I specifically use Calm for the soundscapes to fall asleep to every single night. However, Calm is not the only app which offers these soothing soundscapes and if you Calm developers don‚Äôt start responding to us, your users who have built your app into the very popular app it has become, we will start canceling our subscriptions and use other very similar apps with nearly identical features who also provide basic customer service to their users, something you at the Calm app are sorely lacking!

A week ago, prior to the update which killed the app from launching and then seeing that nobody from the Calm app was acknowledging the upset users of the Calm app, I would have given the app 5 stars... after this PR debacle I would give you ZERO STARS if I were able to, as you at the Calm app have shown just how little you care about your users and their experience with your app. Shame on you, Calm!

title: Customer Service/Cancellation Request
review: I used to love using this app, but found myself using it less and less due to scheduling conflicts. For context, I used to have an android when I started using the app, and switched to Team iPhone at the end of 2019. Around the Summer of 2020, I struggled with the thought of cancelling my subscription because I really love the app, but I wasn‚Äôt using it at all. Finally in December of 2020, I heartbreakingly submitted a request through my Apple Subscriptions to cancel and remove the App. It is now February 2021, and after a month of not receiving any charges from the Calm App, I figured all was well. I was sorely mistaken. When I reached out to their customer service team yesterday, no one was available to reach out and get any information on my cancellation request. This morning at 1:00 am, I get an email from Valerii in the Customer Care department explaining the pending charge process, and that my service will be cancelled as of today. Even after explaining the circumstances of my original cancellation she was extremely rude and essentially stated that it was my fault that the subscription wasn‚Äôt cancelled, despite following the cancellation instructions for Apple products, which is listed on their website. I am now in the process of contacting their corporate offices and have reported them to my bank. Bottom line: make sure you cancel your subscription before getting an iPhone, or they will continue to charge your card through Google!

title: Great app but...

title: I love it but....
review: I‚Äôve been on & off with this app for several years now. Before there was much more free content for you to enjoy & helped you incorporate mindfulness into your life. That is the purpose for most downloading the app not just to ‚Äúget the experience or a feel for it‚Äù. Can be a bummer for people actually struggling with stress or anxiety & you turn to this because you can‚Äôt afford actual therapy & most of the important lessons are locked. You‚Äôll probably get 1 unlocked lesson & that‚Äôs it. Which everyone knows 1 single 10 minute lesson is not nearly enough to see noticeable improvement. There are not even any 100% free modules unless you‚Äôre just doing breathing or a timed meditation (& if you never meditated before or are using your 1 free lesson to help guide you, it can be confusing). I wouldn‚Äôt completely write the app off, they have nice speakers, & soundscapes but if you don‚Äôt spend $$$ you‚Äôre not going to get the experience you need. & that‚Äôs unfortunate for a lot of you. Probably would most benefit by watching mindfulness videos on YouTube & using the free parts of this in conjunction.

title: Love this App - Except for the talking...
review: I‚Äôve now had 2 annual subscriptions to this app. It offers a wide variety of meditation practices for many needs: Short, long, emotions, specific challenges, etc. My biggest complaint is there are very few meditations without a lot of guidance.  Tamara Leavitt seems to be in LOVE with the sound of her own voice and just doesn‚Äôt.stop.talking. The Daily Calm is great but instead of maybe a minute‚Äôs worth of a daily message, it ends up being too much time in a 10 minute session.  (Plus, she sounds preachy.) Please Calm folks, offer some sessions with minimal guidance!

In the ads I‚Äôve seen it DIRECTLY SAYS ‚Äúdownload the -FREE- app now‚Äù and that is a lie please unless you want to pay around 67.99 or around that (a year), you do you I can‚Äôt stop you, but again there is next to no free stuff to use and I‚Äôm extremely dissatisfied this app has SO much potential it‚Äôs crazy but it‚Äôs been crushed by greedy companies who could do so much better and still make a solid profit

title: Great visuals but terrible voices and options
review:
For many of the core programs, the only speaker option is Tamara Levitt and her vocal fry/speech affect is so grating it distracts from the purpose of the app. It‚Äôs like Marianne Williamson‚Äôs mid century MidAtlantic accent crossed with a podcast host starting her own spinnoff from TAL. I cannot.

You can find other content, but what really killed this for me was the inability to push the broadcast to other smart speakers in my home.  Developers claim on Twitter that they‚Äôre ‚Äúworking on an Alexa skill,‚Äù but we pay for this app‚Äî I can push Spotify, which I pay for, to a speaker whether it‚Äôs Alexa, Google or Bluetooth. No reason this can‚Äôt do the same and it‚Äôs not a ‚Äúskill,‚Äù it‚Äôs a feature you‚Äôve chosen not to offer so you can extract more money. Unwise.

I get that y‚Äôall need money but at this point you‚Äôre being selfish you have millions of users who are more than willing to pay for the extra stuff why do you have to take everything else away for the people who can‚Äôt afford it or kids whose parents won‚Äôt buy it for them?!?

review: I NEVER write reviews, but this app made me delete it about three minutes after I downloaded it. I just wanted an app that would allow me to listen to relaxing music while I slept and would also allow me to actually shut my phone off during the night. I usually listen to sleep meditation music on YouTube (so I can‚Äôt lock my screen), but I often find my phone really hot in the middle of the night because of it. I was excited when I first opened this app and saw all of the cool features, but I was quickly disappointed when I realized you have to purchase a premium subscription to actually listen to about 95% of the content provided. What‚Äôs the purpose of that?? I get they need to make money, but then don‚Äôt make this a free app. Charge people to download this so they know what they‚Äôre getting themselves into. All in all, don‚Äôt get this app unless you‚Äôre willing to pay $70 a year to listen to calming music.

title: Nick Offerman Has ONE story / I was charged IMMEDIATELY!
review: Um. Yeah. Got this ad on Instagram of Nick Offerman telling a story and I thought, ‚Äúwhat a neat, relaxing app! I will totally download this and listen to this! Even if it‚Äôs for free for one week!‚Äù (Which. It. Is. Not. According. To. My. Experience). I recall downloading this app probably around 7+ years ago or whenever it first began (it was awhile ago) and it was meh. Seriously meh. Now? It‚Äôs a lot better. I‚Äôll admit that. For what I can speak of, after giving it a spin for the last hour or so. It‚Äôs pretty cool when it comes to almost every other app: I can actually check on something else and close out the app and it will still play. Great. BUT! I have two really big issues: 1) Advertising a famous voice which is literally only a few minutes of the WHOLE APP. Inaccurate advertising. Prove me wrong? Then yeah I‚Äôll pay you all the fees worthy of proper advertisement. 2) So, I downloaded the app which immediately told me that it would be 1 week (6 days) for FREE and then I would have ‚Äúthe option‚Äù to cancel or to be charged the yearly amount which was something like $69‚Äî (don‚Äôt quote me on that, I don‚Äôt remember the exact amount). Nevertheless, within the literal SECOND after I downloaded this app (where all my Apple payments are connected to a PayPal account) I INSTANTLY got a PayPal notification pop up on my phone REGARDING THIS APP that charged me $21.22! Seriously! THE FIRST WEEK ISN‚ÄôT FREE!!!!!!!???? What is this payment? Please refund and/or explain. Cancel my account, while you‚Äôre at it. And please be clear in your advertisements. Aside all this supposed, misleading small print, I think this app could actually be pretty great and I would use it quite often. I‚Äôve spoken with others who‚Äôve had similar issues. Don‚Äôt be misleading / cheap on something that could be a great app for people.

title: Original content (easily worth $100/year)
review:
I just listened to a 18min story by Bobsled Olympian Lauren Gibbs.

This is just one example of original content that Calm has where it is more than just nature sounds (which can be listened on YouTube, Apple Music, Amazon Music or basically anywhere on the web).

-Calm is my personal go-to app for calming nature sounds before bed.

-Go to app to listen to stories while taking a nap.

-Or in general if I feel too anxious from work.

It is well worth the $80/year I paid on March 2020. Just wish I could upload the personal usage statistics (that way I can unbiasly show how much I use it). 

Note to the App Store Developers, you should also let the reviewers show they are verified paid subscribers. Like whenever someone leaves a review on Amazon.

title: Not as great as I hoped but time will tell

It won‚Äôt allow me to create a playlist for multiple stories or guided (sleep) meditations, only for music. That‚Äôs a huge blow considering the FREE Insight Timer allows unlimited playlists and has about 15x the amount of story and meditation options. I‚Äôm sure there are some good things about the Calm app and I hope to discover them but for $39.99, it‚Äôs not worth the money.

But if you are a beginner , I would start with Headspace which I also tried. Andddd...... there is so much relaxation music to listen to as well! I also bought the book on Amazon and it is also beautiful and has a lot of good info in there on sleeping! It‚Äôs a great companion to the app! I‚Äôm so pleased with this app that I bought the full year subscription which is the better deal. It is absolutely worth the money for me because I can finally sleep 7/8 hours every night! It has been a game changer!

title: How hard is it to be honest and state that this app cost money?
review:
I was super excited to try this app out after I saw an advertisement on YouTube. I love falling asleep to the sound of someone telling a story or two people conversing. So of course I downloaded the app and was quit excited to try it last night. What I had missed when I had simply installed it from the YouTube page was the ability to scroll through the full page of information provided in The App Store. What‚Äôs sad is that even on that page the only clue you get that this will cost money is a bit of a ways below the ‚Äúget‚Äù button where you see the ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù app tab and above that is says ‚Äúsubscriptions‚Äù. 

So if you miss that little snippet of info you won‚Äôt realize you have to pay for anything until you go to use the app. The first page that popped up saying ‚Äú7 day trial, then only 69.99 yearly‚Äù I figured was for some sort of premium version of the app, so I closed that message and scrolled through the stories. I was interested in the one I heard advertised, I found it and selected it. Up pops that message again....

No where in ANY of their ads do they mention this app cost money. Not in the ad it‚Äôs self, not in the information bar, there is nothing to tell you it will cost 70$ per year for this app. The ONLY clues that it will cost a dime is the way it is listed in the App Store I mentioned above AND the complaints left by people in the comments on the ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù YouTube ads for when you go look for them and the customer comment 3rd from the left (at the moment). Seriously! How hard is it to list an app as a subscription right at the top? Instead of just saying ‚Äúinstall‚Äù or ‚Äúget‚Äù they should make that button say ‚Äúsubscribe‚Äù. And if you are going to expect people to pay for a full year, the. You better offer a longer trial than 7 days. This was so aggravating I didn‚Äôt get any sleep, so thanks for that. üò°

title: Worth every penny
review: This app. has been such a healing tool for me. I tried free trials for all different ones and this was the one I went with. It‚Äôs got everything I need. I have a diagnosis of C-PTSD, anxiety disorder, and depression from extreme trauma. I knew I needed to help myself, but I was so new to meditation. There‚Äôs so much out there, it made me feel overwhelmed and I just wanted to give up. This app. took me from not knowing anything to teaching me breathing techniques to calm me nerves. It may take a few weeks (on any app) to feel a difference, but stay on course and try to meditate at least every other day in the beginning. I had stomach problems because of my stress. I had to get procedures done only to find out nothing was wrong. I was on my floor, curled in a ball, crying because my stomach was in so much pain. This is gross, but I had loose stools for months as well. I have a degree in psychology, so I do know that our stomachs are our ‚Äúsecond brain.‚Äù Research that. It‚Äôs interesting and so true. Now that I‚Äôve been meditating for a month, my stomach issues are GONE. You don‚Äôt have to sit perfectly straight or sit on the floor. I sit on my bed with my legs straight out and my head tilted downward, arms on my lap. That position relaxes me. Find what relaxes you and go with it. Some like to sit on floors with a completely straight back, but that only made me feel uptight. There‚Äôs no right or wrong way to meditate. You choose what‚Äôs comfortable. I walk and listen to it sometimes just to soothe myself. Remember, you are human and you will have random thoughts. DO NOT get frustrated with yourself. Just bring your thoughts back to meditating. If you are on a 7 day series and want to listen to day 2 over and over for the next few days because it helped you and touched you, do it. You make the rules. Whatever you‚Äôre comfortable with, you do it that way. Remember, you are retraining your brain and that takes time. Don‚Äôt give up. I‚Äôd suggest you try free trials for this app and a few more to see what you like. Everyone I‚Äôve talked to, goes back to this. It‚Äôs just amazing. Calming music, sleep stories, meditation for different issues, different meditation times. The narrators voices are so soothing. Just try it out. If you do the work, I promise, you‚Äôll see a change. Also, do positive affirmations as well as meditating. You can find them on YouTube. Fill your head with all things good and you‚Äôll be ok!! Much love.

title: Very polished app that works.
review:
This is a fantastic product. There are so many guided meditations you can enjoy that are very helpful in the free products that you first have access to. There's also a good variety in types and goals for your meditation focus. 

The pacing and tone of the guidance is on the slow side, which is what I happen to like. Most of the lessons are like 10-20 minutes long, so not great if you're a person who cannot dedicate that time. Some of the free products have shorter guided meditations, but there's not many. 

The background noise and overall look is very polished, so if aesthetics are what your looking for in a meditation product, just the great little videos of calming places will ease your mind. They certainly do for me. 

My one suggestion, and reason for the missing star, is that that I really want to be able to preview and purchase some of the series on the app a la carte - kinda like how you preview and purchase songs on iTunes. This product doesn't let you do that, instead you have to pay for a premium membership, which I'm not sure I can justify given how many times I am  able to meditate each month. If you're in the same boat I am, that is a definite drawback in product design for you and is something to keep in mind when downlpading the app.

10-30-2020. It‚Äôs been years since I‚Äôve had this app. I took the plunge and paid for premium like... 5 years ago and it‚Äôs worth it. I happily pay for the service each year and added the missing star back from my previous rating. Aside from that, everything else I‚Äôve said previously about this app still stands. It‚Äôs a solid app.

title: Can‚Äôt Say Enough
review:
I started the Calm App 2 years ago after my first panic attack. I use the sleep stories more than anything else but also enjoy the check in‚Äôs, the breathing cycle and many of the classes. 
Just recently I purposely for a week did not listen to a sleep story and fell asleep on my own. My nights were restless and my Fitbit sleep scores went down noticeably.
I‚Äôm a COVID-19 Long Hauler (symptoms began in March). Here it is almost November and I‚Äôm still having lingering symptoms. Am on 2 COVID Survivor support groups and have recommended Calm to many. Especially for breathing exercises, anxiety, depression & insomnia.
A HUGE thank you to Tamara and team.
PS - returned to my Calm routine last night. Listened to several meditations, practiced my breathing & fell asleep to Anne of Green Gables (which is also an excellent series on either Netflix or Amazon Prime).

review: Game changer. Took up using calm daily early in the pandemic. Totally worth the annual cost, but like a gym membership, you must commit to using it everyday. Daily use over weeks and months are where you‚Äôll see the most progress.The more you use it, the more you will benefit from it, especially during tough times.

title: Only downloading the app is free!!!!
review: I deleted this app within the first 5 minutes of downloading it. Only downloading the app is free. Every thing else in the app will take you to a page to sign up for the yearly subscription which as of today showed $69.99. They don‚Äôt have any trials to any of the courses! This is the first time I am writing a review on the App Store as I felt like this app is only trying to extract the yearly fees for what it has to offer! I am already going through a ton of stress in this pandemic & I thought I could use this app to try & help calm myself down but in vain! If you are truly looking to destress yourself then the only way is to shell out the yearly fees! I am unable to afford it & so this app is not for me. But I do want the creators of this app know that your advertising on YouTube had falsely lured me to download this app. You should have mentioned the price in the advertisement clearly instead of playing such marketing gimmicks. I recommend the Apple App Store to tighten its rules against such apps and clearly show the subscription price prior to download of any app. Highly disappointed with the Calm Team & the Apple App Store team!

title: Calm.calm
review:
The themes from entirely different starting points do often blend, or associate with one another, towards a constructive end, fortunately.  This was surprising and welcoming.
I use the site daily as recommended, initially for essentially refractory anxiety, and was (and am still) amazed that this practice was so helpful.  
It‚Äôs about mindfulness and has nothing to do with religion or those extremes, which I would not be a part of.  
One should know there are many wonderful contributors, which I parenthetically state who are exemplary of kindness and generosity of spirit.
I am so grateful.

title: Testing content before purchasing, is almost non-existent.
review:
There used to be at least three or four free sleep stories on here, which was too bad. However in recent times, it seems they have since locked them up, and I could only find one. The rest of the library is only available to be heard with a ‚Äúpremium subscription.‚Äù 

The only thing you might be able to hear for free, is the background noise that you can choose when you first open the Calm app, one sleep story that I could find, and a couple of the meditations offer the first one free (in a line of multiple ones, that come with it). 

This app is also incredibly expensive too. $69.99 (basically $70 USD) to get the premium subscription you need. And there is no other ‚Äúlevels‚Äù to the subscriptions either ‚Äî just the premium one. Thanks to COVID putting a bunch of people out of work, I don‚Äôt see how most regular folks who live paycheck to paycheck, are going to be able to afford to spare that (when they‚Äôre struggling as is, and probably need an outlet to relax to more than most). 

I‚Äôm very disappointed with the creators of this app. The optics are not good here. They look extremely greedy. There‚Äôs no doubt the materials are good, from what I have been able to use ‚Äî but I assure it‚Äôs not worth a $70 USD charge, when I (and many others) can get better for free on YouTube ‚Äî and their ASMR creators actually release new materials weekly. 

Best recommendation for them? Come up with a subscription tier. Come down on your price, and open up more things for free users ‚Äî just enough to entice them into wanting to actually buy from you. Stop frustrating your users with all the locks, and greed.

review: I think the app has a great layout with a good library of stories and meditations.  I have anxiety and incessant thoughts that I need to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù down quite often.  The sleep stories are awesome to listen to. Tamara Levitt is one of the main meditation leaders on this app, and to and be quite honest, I cannot listen to her ‚Äúcheerlead-y‚Äù voice when I‚Äôm trying to meditate, let alone, fall asleep.  Her voice is not calming to me at all, and I know her intention is good, but I think that she and the app managers should realize this.  Some people just aren‚Äôt cut out for every job.  I‚Äôm surprised that she doesn‚Äôt tone down her voice; maybe she just can‚Äôt. The good thing is that there are options to switch to male voices, which is my preference, but that‚Äôs not always the case.  I think the 7 day trial was definitely worth it, but the subscription costs of $59.99 is steep for me having to cut out a lot of its content.  Worth trying.

title: This app is better free than some reviews state
review: I was going to say this app was seriously not that good until I came across ‚Äúscenes‚Äù. Ok so I got this app for free after watching the hundreds of ads everywhere I went and was very intrigued by the color blending ad, keys swinging ad and the endless tube ad(if you know you know). I wanted more of this satisfying and calming experience so I gave it a try. Then I went through the whole app and man it sucked, the only thing that was unlocked was 4 very random short stories and 2 meditations! I know it‚Äôs free, but definitely not worth downloading, I could just watch a free YouTube video instead or listen to a podcast. Then when all hope was lost I clicked on the final page, and there was the free gold, no stories, no satisfying graphics, but there were tons of different lovely sound meditations all for free, and you can pick from many scenes such as plains of wheat and snowflakes in moonlight. I love it!! You can even set a timer for how long you want it to play while clicking out of the app to do something else on your phone and you are magically transported to a new location!! I just wish that the ads were true to the app. Also, I would never in any right mind pay anywhere close to over $60 a year for this though because there is not enough on the app all together. I definitely suggest the developers make the app just like the ads and it would be 100000000 times better!!

title: Pay $70 or get bent I guess?
review:
95% of anything you can listen to on this "free" app requires payment, and the ones you can hear for free are very lackluster (just barely good enough to compel you to pay). 
I don't mind paying for apps or content within a free app (even at the $70 yearly price), however, I DO mind when a paid only app pretends to be free to lure users in. 
You're better off looking up sleep sounds on youtube than wasting your money on these misers, seriously.

Seriously?

What ever happened to simply buying an app and paying ONE TIME?  Everything is locked up tight unless you immediately sign up for premium.  If you‚Äôre anxious to relief stress, I would think that not paying an exorbitant amount would go a long way towards achieving that goal. 

NO app that just plays sounds is worth that kind of money...ever.

title: Meh
review:
I tried premium for one year. I like guided meditation, and I like white-noise. I'm not crazy about Tamara Levitt's voice, and she's on nearly every track. I really didn't care for the content on the app- for my own meditation/mindfulness needs.
 I can find meditation sessions online that are just as nice, for free. Same goes for white-noise apps to play while I sleep. Overall, not impressed.
I'm also really disappointed that Calm has this "auto-subscribe" option right now. I was sleeping last night, and woke up to a notification that I "purchased" a free trial of calm, with an auto-purchase in place for seven days from now. Now, how do you create an app that is SO easy at taking your money that it purchases trials for you in your sleep?! I feel like it's not transparent. And now I'm watching my back to make sure $69.99 doesn't come out of my bank account, even though I've deleted the app and cancelled the auto-renew subscription. I don't trust this app anymore. And it's not worth it for the mediocre sessions either. Sorry. You're better off on youtube or another app.

title: What happened to the limited free stuff?
review: I liked the app.  I only had the free version which is only what I needed but now the limited free stuff is gone and you need the premium account to access anything.  Premium is too expensive especially when you can find similar stuff on other apps or YouTube.

title: Really counter productive
review: This is an app that lets you try it for a bit to see if you like it then charges you for the entire year (by clicking yes right after you register, there is no trial period) if you would like to use its capabilities. It does not care if your circumstances change within the year and would like a refund for months that you cannot/did not use the app (I know first-hand they refused to refund me). You can only fully use for the year or NOT AT ALL. They do this for a reason. Think twice before going premium. There are tons of FREE (and better) YouTube videos for guided meditation, stories, and relaxation. This is an actual insidious company.

title: The app is Free, all the content is behind a subscription paywall. Only one free meditation.
review:
I downloaded this app to help with my stress levels during the COVID-19 lockdown in my state. I did my first guided meditation yesterday under the 7 days of calm which was ‚ÄúUnlocked‚Äù. I came back today to find that the rest of the intro to meditation section is LOCKED behind a pay wall. 

How can I even decide if I want to pay for this app Which by the way Costs $69.99 a year. If I can‚Äôt even use the basic intro to meditation to see if this will help me.

Since nobody from the company will probably read this I pose to any potential users, what‚Äôs the point of an app where 99.9% of the content is locked and you have to pay $69.99 per year to keep it unlocked. The app should just cost $69.99 and not be free. As Free is misleading.

I am super disappointed that this app doesn‚Äôt even get me through a week to see if I want to shell out $69.99 for something I might not use.

It‚Äôs really relax and very helpful. My only complaint, that I have is the pricing. I understand that this app so much to offer for so many needs. However $14.99 a month just isn‚Äôt in my budget and neither is the yearly membership. The 7 day trial was nice but then as soon as it ended, I was like great. The only thing I can really listen to now is the music I saved for sleeping. I would pay for this app if the prices were lower.

title: Thank you Calm App and team
review:
It is 3am and Today is my day 282...my longest streak since I started using Calm on 12/25/2018.  Thank you for providing an app that is easy to use, always a my fingertip to help me practice balancing my life.  I am grateful this app helps me practice meditation techniques and there are so many different ways to practice. (stories, music, short and long meditations, different back ground music/scenes, masterclasses.) At first the app taught me how to calm myself...but now I realized I am learning something more valuable...I am learning how to practice RAIN which helps me realize and acknowledge strong emotions but not get swept away by the emotions. 

So Happy International Calm Day! Thank you for teaching me ways to fall back to sleep when I realize my mind is racing due to the new stresses COVID19 pandemic has created.  

If you are wondering if this app can help...try it and be patient with yourself. Start with baby-steps, listen while you cook, clean, walk, color.  Over time I realized all the practice has helped me build a stronger foundation.  

I am forever grateful to Calm App.  We got this...May we all sleep well and get the rest we need.  Keep breathing, looking, naming, feeling, and watching the emotion pass like bubbles, balloons, clouds , waves, or ......... zzzzzzzz  zzzzzzz zzzzz.

title: Life Changing!
review: We all live extremely busy lives.  I can‚Äôt encourage you enough to create a 10 min space in your day (preferably this should be the very first thing you do when you wake up) and listen to the daily calm.  If you are consistent with this every single day you will go through an amazing life transformation! You will be able to slow things down. You will be able to interrupt negative thoughts during the day because this will give you the mental muscle to do so. You can only control 4 things in your life... your results, your thoughts, your emotions, and your actions. The ability to control your thoughts and emotions MUST become priority #1 in your life or else those 2 things will forever control YOU.  The 10 min daily calm is the key to you gaining control over your thoughts and emotions. It‚Äôs going to take work but it will be the greatest accomplishment of your life! Friend me up on Facebook and/or follow me on Instagram at Paul Kroto. I love connecting with like minded people so message me!! Elev8 Your Life!!!

As someone who meditates without any guidance I would have loved to change things up. For the price point I am not willing to compromise and pay for mindfulness. I am sure someone is making a great deal of money thanks to this system. I hope that this has allowed them to further reach their highest potential. Sadly, there are no free services for someone novice who is looking to discover the benefits of meditation. Try YouTube.

title: Don‚Äôt download this app its highway robbery!!!!!

This is robbery and I will be continuing to tell anyone I know who is technically inclined and might be inclined to download this app that it is nothing more than a scam to steal your money and the ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù is a lure. I am extremely disappointed in the dishonesty of this company and will continue to voice this on all of my social media accounts as I did not want this service and took all necessary steps to not pay for it. But rather lost over $100 dollars because the apps taken time out of my paycheck as well as money out of my account so save yourself time and money and get on YouTube to listen to calming and FREE material. title: BUYER BEWARE, THIS APP KILLS YOUR BATTERY
review: I loved this app when I first purchased it; now, I would give it a negative number if I could. Initially, it provided great sleep stories and daily meditations, however when I updated my IPhone to the latest operating system as required for the phone to work, the phone, which used to shut off by itself after a story or a daily meditation no longer shut down. It would stay on, playing music all night while I slept. For three days in a row, I woke up to a COMPLETELY DRAINED BATTERY which took over 20 minutes to recover. case you are not aware, this will DESTROY YOUR BATTERY! I emailed Calm‚Äôs customer support (by the way, they have no voice support, only email which they answer sporadically.) Thy made inane suggestions like turning off the app after listening to it. This makes zero sense if you are using it to fall asleep. I tried multiple times to work with Calm to fix this to no avail.  Eventually, they admitted that they were aware of the problem and that their technicians were ‚Äúworking on it.‚Äù Just out of curiosity, I checked the web to see if anyone else had this problem. I found that THIS PROBLEM GOES BACK TO 2017! I As a last ditch effort, I decided to go to Apple to see if they could help. I made an appointment which typically costs $50.00. The good news is that my IPhone battery doesn‚Äôt have to be replaced and they didn‚Äôt charge me. However, they told me in no uncertain terms to delete Calm as they could see how it depleted the battery. I would never recommend this NIGHTMARE to anyone else. STAY AWAY!

You folks place ads .. on sites like youtube ... with specific and recognizeable speakers .. like the French Whisperer ... and then provide no way for yr customers to go directly to what they want. In this case a video spoken BY the French Whisperer . Which makes zero sense.

title: Great- But High Priced...
review:
I heard about the calm app from my school counselor. She showed us the LeBron James meditations, and I fell in love. Then my teacher started playing music from the calm app during class, so when I got home, I downloaded it. The only problem is: everything seems to be locked. I was hoping at least some of the stuff would be free, but $69.99? 
In addition, I also feel like without the subscription, it is just a demo. You aren‚Äôt really getting the whole thing, and I was disappointed when I found out. The whole thing just seems like it wants you to have the first podcast to listen to for free, then see how awesome it is, and pay for it. But I can‚Äôt afford to pay $69.99 for a meditation app, especially when there are free ones out there.
But, some pros, the podcasts and mediations are AMAZING. The people who do them have such a calming voice, and the music is my personal favorite. (I know this all from when my teacher and school counselor introduced it to us) 
But, if you do not want to spend $69.99, I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend this unless you really would like this app.

I did not want lebron James!! I wanted small rain fall or maybe a bedtime story but not one is free!!! I would rather have ads pop up on the screen this bull crap!! I‚Äôm 14 and in need of sleep but I can‚Äôt pay money like Willy nillly!!! Get yourself together!!!

title: Read please
review: Horrible app. Almost everything is a ‚Äúpremium‚Äù feature and it cost $70.00 a year and hasn‚Äôt even helped me fall asleep. You‚Äôre better of worth some deep sleep music for YouTube. Plus the narrations are horrible.

title: 1 week free trial is a SCAM!  App is $97.00!
review:
Calm offers a free week trial. I tried it and did not like it. Next thing I know, I somehow own the app, at $97.00 it is expensive and nothing like the wonderful commercials. 
I asked for refund, but I am stuck with it for one year!  What a rip off. Do not be fooled by 1 week free trial. It is a scam!

title: Bait and switch
review: I tried to sign up for month to month payments but somehow accidentally selected annual pricing. I just wanted to try the app out and ended up getting charged $70 for a full year. I contacted apple support (as the app does not offer this support) and was told my purchase ‚Äúdid not qualify for a refund‚Äù even though I still wanted to spend money on it, just not $70. This type of bait and switch pricing policy is ludicrous. And in the end there isn‚Äôt even any content on the app that find useful. I‚Äôve used a number of mediation apps and I find free videos on YouTube to be far more useful and the content much more diverse than this app. I now have a $70 blue icon on my home page. I can tell you I sure as hell will never download anything from this company again. Skip this app, especially stay away from the ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù.

title: Too much is premium
review: This app is actually pretty helpful and good for personal growth. I had one complaint with it though. It is one of those apps that is constantly bringing up the premium option. I didn't want to purchase premium because it was a bit too expense for  me. But I downloaded the app because it included sleep sounds and I needed that because I had been looking for sleep sound apps and not many I tried were good. This one seemed like the real deal to me. But you have to search and search to find a music or a sleep sound that's not premium and usually the not premium ones aren't all that good. Now I know that the point of premium is to include the better features, but I don't think all that searching for a mediocre sleep sound that's not premium isn't worth it.
